Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kim1974
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is one of the oldest in Venice, dating back to the 12th Century. It is steeped in Italian tradition and the general decor is simply stunning. The location is literally a minute's walk from St Mark's Square so it's perfect if you want to be in the hub of it all. The staff are courteous, helpful and professional. One point to consider is that for the amount of mony spent, you could expect a larger room. The deluxe was a little disappointing in size, but overal, the typical venetian style and the small balcony overlooking the small canal below were charming. Ask for a high room floor to get the best possible view. We were on the 3rd floor and our view of the Grand Canal was restricted. In terms of comfort and cleanliness, the double bed was two beds joined together (as with many European hotels) and there was a morning maid service as well as turn down service in the evening. The hotel also has its own private landing strip for the water taxis so arriving in one of these and straight into the hotel is a fabulous and glamourous experience. Enjoy it! Incidently, the hotel also offers a courtesy water taxi to a glass making factory in Murano. If you have an appreciation for fine Murano glass and intend purchasing, then this place is worth going to. We don't and the pushy guide who took us around the showroom was very disgruntled that we didn't buy anything! The breakfast room in the hotel is magnificent - the ceiling frescos were created by students under Tiepolo's tutelage and it was a real pleasure to start the day off in these breathtaking surroundings. The quality and choice of the buffet breakfast was excellent. For those who would be interested in WiFi, there is no free access. An hourly charge is applied. Venice itself is a beautiful city. The best way to appreciate it is by foot. Apart from the obvious attractions like the Basilica, Doges Palace, Bell Tower, Rialto Bridge, Academy Bridge, it is just lovely to walk the small winding streets and discover a little church or browse past the quaint shops. Or just sit in a street cafe with a gelato and watch a gondola pass by. A gondola experience is a must - it is approx EUR 80 for approx 30 minutes and you can pick them up all around the city. We also enjoyed afternoon tea at Florian, which is an early 18th Century tea room, with an Orchestra that plays outside to add to the ambience. It is not cheap (a cup of tea with cost EUR 10) but this is the premium you pay around St Mark's and for us, it was worth doing. Meal times - we adore Italian food so dining for us was no problem. We picked places at random and were not disappointed. If however your palate craves something else, there is a Hard Rock Cafe just off St Mark's Sq. A superb stay in a superb hotel in a superb city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: stargazer43
Reviews.Content: Went at Carnival time in February and wanted a hotel with a great location and some style. based on Trip Advisor reviews I managed to get a room at the hotel for a week. My initial impression when I wrote to the hotel asking them if they could arrange to pick me up from the airport and was told to write to the Concierge - instead of forwarding my email - was not good! I also asked the hotel to reserve a table for me at a well known and popular restaurant and all I got was a response that their restaurant was very good and I should book there instead? I got this response twice despite politely declining their kind invitation! Not a good start.... However, once they picked up the ball everything ran like clock work. We were met as promised and elegantly transferred via the Grand Canal to the hotel. The only hiccup was when we arrived no one was there to take the luggage so I was obliged to heave the suitcases from the boat onto the jetty.... Our check in was warm and friendly. The General Manager came to receive us and it felt more like being welcomed into somebody's house than a hotel. Top marks here. Our room was small but bijou. You can see it on their web site. The only thing that let it down was a noisy HVAC fan whose bearings were clearly worn out. Breakfast is served in the former ballroom of this Palazzo with beautiful classical paintings to compliment a good, if not fantastic, buffet breakfast managed professionally by ever attentive staff. We eventually had dinner in the hotel and the food was excellent. Snacks and drinks are served in the downstairs bar all day. Again good quality food, drink and service. In the evenings they have, on occasion, a great musician playing a wide repertoire of music. The concierge team are first rate. Helpful, attentive and ever ready to offer good advice and to please. If you stay in this hotel, use them as they can improve the overall quality of your stay in this beautiful city. The hotel is situated literally around the corner from St Marks Square, the heart of the city. But its location is in a quiet backwater so after beating your way through the crowds and noise you turn a corner and it is quiet and clear. The Baglioni stages masked balls with food, period dancing and modern disco dancing to live music as well as via a DJ. They are well organised, a lot of fun and the best thing is you get to meet people from all over the world who are there to have fun. All ages, all sizes. Dressed up and masked. You can rent everything you need from Paola who manages a rental business in the hotel. One of the nicest people you can ever hope to meet who will advise and help you select a costume. She has a great team who despite the pressure always deliver. A great complimentary service to the hotel Baglioni. I can recommend this hotel without reservation. It is expensive, but for a special trip in a special city that will leave memories for life it is worth it

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: samlab25
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last stop on our Italian vacation. We were traveling with our 10 year old son and we prefer suites as opposed to adjoining rooms for him. We had a wonderful arrival in the private water taxi they arranged, right up the front door of the hotel. Very romantic. Our room was not quite ready, so we had lunch in the main dining room. Nice, great staff, however, our favorite things from the menu were our son's Veal Milanese and the Evolution of Tiramisu (mint, berry and traditional tiramisu). As soon as our suite was ready we headed up, the room was nice, very large with a GREAT view of the Lagoon. Our room was the Tizano Suite. It was very spacious and definitely decorated in the Venitian style. The one thing we did not like about the suite was the exercise bike in the room blocking one of the windows overlooking the Lagoon. I was hoping to place one of the comfy wing chairs there and read. When asking the concierge if they could remove the bike, he was taken aback, but when we returned to the hotel that night, it was gone. Hopefully thy did not put it back. It takes away the charm of such a beautiful view and the Venetian style. I would like to have seen the electronics in the rooms (small TV's just sitting on top of tables with multiple cords, 5 channels, etc.) a little more updated, however, one does not come to Venice to sit in the room and watch TV or browse the internet for hours. It is a city to be enjoyed and revered. There were a few things, electronics included, that would prevent me from giving the hotel 5 stars. The hotel was beautiful, but something about it was bordering on older, just in need of some updating and renovations. Nothing was sub par or sub standard, but it just didn't have quite the shine or polish of a true 5 star. That said, I would still recommend this hotel. The location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Vintageracer43
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a really fabulous location. They go out of their way to accomodate ones needs or requests. We had a room issue and the front desk staff was very responsive and corrected the problem right away in a very gentlemanly way. The resulting change had a great view of the lagoon. The concierge staff is excelllent! The breakfast was very nice ( one of the nicest on our trip) and served in a beautiful room, the Marco Polo ballrooom, with a delightful hostess each morning. The hotel was very clean and the linens were of nice quality although the beds were really firm even by european standards. We would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chi_LonTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a perfect location with old world charm. As described on some other reviews, the antiques and furnishings really make this hotel unique. Service is elegantly executed but understated, all which makes for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: laurie w
Reviews.Content: I can't think of anything negative to say about our experience at the Luna Baglioni Hotel. The service was flawless, our suite the most beautiful we've ever seen, decorated with antiques and adorned with a huge terrace. The food at the hotel exquisite. My husband and I are very well traveled and very discriminating and we loved this place. The Ritz in Paris pales in comparison!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel in an amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Venice was made even more enjoyable by this amazing hotel. We arrived by water taxi and were greeted by friendly staff. Throughout our stay, all of the staff went above and beyond to provide great service. Our room was on the second floor with a small balcony overlooking the canal entrance to the hotel. What a fabulous view. The room was spacious, high ceiling and beautiful furnishings. The bathroom was one of the largest I have ever seen in a luxury hotel. A buffet breakfast was available in a beautiful large room covered with murals. It made us feel like royalty, and the food was great! The hotel is in a perfect location, about 150 yards from the Piazza San Marco. It was very easy to go for short walks any time of the day from this location. Free water taxis were available at the hotel to take you to Murano to see the glass factories. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice. I have been fortunate to stay in some great hotels in my life, and this one ranks near the top of the list!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tridoc59
Reviews.Content: We couldn't praise this hotel enough....fantastic! Booked a three night stay to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday so were looking for something special...and got it! Staff are friendly, approachable and professional. Shown personally to our room to find a bottle of prosecco chilling in an ice bucket, room (room 211) beautifully furnished and immaculate, small balcony overlooking side canal so we could stand and watch the gondellas and water-taxi bringing other guests. Despite this amazingly quiet considering just 50m from St Marks Square. We looked at other similar hotels (Danielli, Bauer and Metropole etc) and certainly wouldn't have swapped. Breakfast standard continental buffet of good quality and staff attentive,helpful and friendly. We slept so well, nice firm beds and good quality linen, usual chocolate on pillow in the evening. The only downside is restaurant so very expensive and lacking ambience but as plenty of alternatives to be found on wandering through the streets it was not a problem. If and when we return we won't even think twice about booking this hotel again it was so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Baglioni as special as you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Z H
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise trip for me to Venice by my then boyfriend but now fiance after our trip. I've always stayed in the Cipriani with my parents over the years. For December particularly I think it was beautiful! Stunning room looking over the Grand Canal; stunning breakfast room; around the corner from Harrys which was a winner; prosecco and strawberrys left in the room every night. So romantic; beautiful place highly liked the location too different than Cipriani just but so convienient. Wonderful concierge too!! So helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Billymyb0y
Reviews.Content: This is one of the "great hotels of the world" and to come out and to come out, get into a water taxi and turn almost immediately into the Grand Canal is pretty incredible. It's the best location you could find in Venice. The surroundings and rooms are luxurious and spotless and Concierge v helpful. Also central and easy to explore around-we were there during Aqau Alta and had a great time watching people stroll along through the water in black bin bags (some entrepreneur was doing a roaring trade and we watched from our balcony in fits of hysteria). If I had a concern-tiny bit "up itself" maybe?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BbytthDr
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star hotel with a 5 star price, although I did get a great deal through Amex Plat. My two daughters and I stayed here 3 nights. They upgraded us to a larger suite, and there was no problem when I asked to bring a rollaway into the living room (I had mentioned this when booking the room). The bathroom was large with plenty of light, and there was plenty of closet and storage space. It took a while to figure out the light switches, and my circuit breakers tripped once, but the staff came and fixed the problem. It was warm in the room because the heaters were on everywhere (even though it was 60 degrees outside), and I wasn't able to turn on a fan or AC, but I just opened the windows, although it was pretty noisy with windows open (well insulated and quiet when they were closed). The breakfast room was lovely and the food was fine, my daughters loved the hot chocolate! Beware that they are very proud of the room service food (100 Euros for soup, caprese salad, a kids' spagetti and two milks), but you'll pay a lot wherever you go. The staff was very attentive and responsive, and I would definitely return. You can't beat the location and the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joek65
Reviews.Content: What a fantatstic experience. Have stayed at other hotels in venice before but this is a tad above all but the very best. The surroundings are excellent the staff very professional and friendly and could'nt be more convinient in you intend to stay central. The ballroom itself is worth a view.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: jackieshoes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at the Luna Baglioni. The rooms were well appointed and staff very friendly indeed. I thought overall it was excellent value. I will definitely return. Thank you staff at the Luna Baglioni. Also, the beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dave C
Reviews.Content: From arrival we were made to feel valued guests. This hotel is first class in every respect. We stayed in one of the suites and it was excellent. The hotel has a classy feel about it and the standard of decor is high. The staff across the board were great and it was an enjoyable stay. Its location beside St Marks Square cannot be beaten. This was our first visit to Venice and so it we could not have chosen a better hotel or location. We took a private water taxi from the airport and this hotels entrance is on the waterfront, so we stepped off the taxi into the hotel. It is not a cheap hotel but the experience matches the price. We visited during the carnival weeks and though it was cold, it is a great time to visit as large numbers of people take part, dressed and masked for much of the time. Many special events are on during this period.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location professinal staff”
Reviews.Author: Margeritta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just located off St Marks square walking distance from St Marks square and boat services. Hotel is traditional in style but suites Venice as it is a romantic city. Try not to get rooms in block A as it is a courtyard rooms and can be very noisy. Would recommend for anyone who is looking to stay in Venice with walking distance to all sights.

Reviews.Title: “a couple of days in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dissydes
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Europe for my wife and me.I am 60 and my wife 51,we travelled by overnight train,from Paris,I slept okay but she did not.At the railway station we bought a travelpass for the vaporetta,which takes you to the hotel.The trip takes about 20 minutes,the hotel is 50 meters from the San Marco ferry stop. The location is excellent next to Piazza San Marco.Our room was spacious and the bathroom had an opening window.The room had a balcony,with sideway view of the Canal Grande.The breakfast room was fabulous! The concierge staff were great,they bought train tickets for our trip to Milano.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: totjelly
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be faulted due to its proximity to St Marks Square. It is very beautiful inside and the ballroom where they serve breakfast is particularly spectacular. Our room was large and grand but I was disappointed with the bathroom as it was extremely tired looking and, judging by other reviews, some rooms have state of the art bathroom suites. However, it was spotlessly clean. I was there for a special birthday and wish my husband had mentioned this to the management as we might have received a complimentary upgrade. Our room overlooked a courtyard, the cost of lagoon view rooms was prohibitive. There were no drink making facilities in the room apart from a mini bar and this was unfortunate. The breakfast selection was excellent and once more the service could not faulted. The staff could not do enough for you and the Concierge was marvellous, at our request he recommended a number of restaurants and made the reservations for us. Il Paradiso on the other side of the Rialto Bridge was particularly good and full of locals which is always a good sign. On our first night we ate in the hotel's restaurant Canova, we were waited on like royalty and the food was good. However, it was shockingly expensive so make sure you look at the prices prior to booking a table, the menu you are presented with at the table is price free and, after a complimentary glass of Prosecco, it is easy to throw caution to the wind and splash out. The hotel arrange a daily complimentary water taxi to Murano. Upon arrival a very kind lady helped me step out of the taxi and then I realised she had appointed herself our guide and consequent sales person. It was a very hard sell but we are not naive and only purchased because we wanted to. With hindsight I wish we had made our own way to the island and had the option to tour a number of factories and Murano itself alone rather than being committed to one location. In terms of time of year, it was exceptionally bitterly cold and in the outer regions, the water was slushy ice. It was nice and sunny though. We were able to get a table on St Marks Square which I should imagine is more of a challenge in the spring and summer. It was the Venice Carnival during our stay and lovely to see the locals in their beautiful costumes and masks. We visited the Doges Palace, Harry's Bar (almost adjacent to the Hotel) for a Bellini and ate divine Ricotta Cheesecake in the Florian Tearooms which is very beautiful. All worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia L
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Venice, my husband and I got extremely lost and took the wrong train and ended up 20km away in a town called Mira Buse. It was at night and the train was the last train to come through the station. I rang the concierge for help and he promptly organised a taxi to come and pick us up from the station and then followed up with a water taxi to arrive at the front door of the hotel. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the Marco Polo room where we had breakfast each morning is like being in a fancy ballroom. We spent half the time admiring the decor. The staff at the hotel were excellent, the concierge guided us with maps, explanations and even organised concert tickets for us. The room is large and well presented, the housekeeping staff would visit twice a day to refresh the room with towels and turn down beds, etc. We even got chocolates everyday. The location of the hotel is fabulous, right in the heart of San Marco, everything is just a short walk or boat ride away. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Preeti147
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful and as expected there is a real attention to detail from the minute you walk in - the staff were faultless. It's located in the fashionable part, right by Chanel and LV so all your (window) shopping needs are on on your doopstep. They offer a free water taxi to the glass making factory where the cheapest thing we saw was â‚¬150 for 6 glasses so be wary of this. Other than that a fantastic stay in a beautiful city. Definitely worth spending a little more for that extra treat.

Reviews.Title: “Another visit 21 years later - still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: surfersimon
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at the Luna a few times in the early 90's and found it lovely. Fantastic location just off the Grand Canal and St Mark's with all the covenience of almost everything on the doorstep. It is an expensive hotel but you get what you pay for, the rack rates are half that of the summer rates. Summer is, in my book, to be avoided and there is nothing quite like Venice in the winter. Everything about the hotel was flawless, from service to breakfast, room service, concierge services. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful honeymoon location”
Reviews.Author: CarolinePLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent the first five days of our honeymoon at the Baglioni and had a fabulous time. We were greeted with cocktails and a small but stunning room overlooking the Grand Canal. The hotel is on the south side of the Grand Canal looking north and it has a lovely little terrace almost at water level, which is a great place to have a sundowner. The service is impeccable and very discreet. After the first night however we realised it was like sleeping above a bus lane .. but the hotel happily moved us to a huge room overlooking the courtyard at the back. The location is fabulous: literally a 30 sec trip across the canal and 5 minutes from all the major tourist attractions .. but even better 5 mins and 30 mins away from the tourist attractions and located in the peaceful Dorsodoro ... we spent hours just wondering around the peaceful streets, stopping off a tiny cafes and bars off the beaten track .. and saw a side of Venice most probably dont bother to see. The hotel itself is supermodern inside .. our bathroom had an entirely glass basin .... and it was difficult to see the edges of it against the gold leaf floor .. but we had fun [and a few broken glasses trying].

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: cmarieleahy
Reviews.Content: The hotel organized our pick-up from the train station in Venice, arrived in style, dropped off our bags in a gorgeous room. So luxe, I've never stayed anyplace like it,,,felt like I stepped back in time and was staying in some gorgeous Venetian palace from hundreds of years ago. Prior to our arrival the concierge had made reservations for a gondala ride for my husband and I which would drop us off at our dinner reservations. The next day we met our tour guide...again through the concierge, we had pre-arranged for a private hour and a half walking tour...and she was fabulous. Everything was top notch...it's a great location, close to everything, great view from our balcony. I will say this...it was pricey, but it was a special occasion for us and in my opinion, it was worth it....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a lovely place”
Reviews.Author: georginanorthants
Reviews.Content: I was taken away for a surprise trip to Venice and this hotel made it extra special. The whole hotel is beautiful, decorated luxuriously with many interesting antiques . The room was the best part. We were upgraded to a deluxe room on arrival. The bed was very comfy and the dÃ©cor was typical venetian. Truly romantic for a special weekend away. The breakfast was also exceptional, served in the main hall with plenty to choose from. The dÃ©cor in this hall is also beautiful. Location was great, close to everywhere but in a quiet spot. You can even get a gondola from the front door. Hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel again and again!! May be expensive but well worth the money if you want something to remember!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: H B
Reviews.Content: I stayed travelled to Venice for three nights with my girlfriend early December 2011 and after having got tired of looking through too many hotels that looked nice but had terrible reviews we settled on the Luna as both photos and reviews looked great. We were not disappointed, in fact I would say our stay at the Luna made our trip to Venice the best trip it could be. The location, service and standard of the hotel is pretty much as good as it gets. As we arrived at the Hotel the staff was very friendly, and the Hotel Manager came down to greet us personally. We were given a suite at no extra cost, with a bottle of prosecco waiting for us in our room. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated as royalty, from exceptionally efficient and courteous room service, to friendly bartenders to incredibly accommodating restaurant staff (do try the hotel Restaurant, called the Canova, it is delicious!). All in all, full marks for this Hotel, and an absolute must for anyone who wishes to travel to Venice. It doesn't get much better than this. Lastly, remember that Venice is expensive, not the kind of place one goes on a budget holiday, so even though this hotel is slightly higher in price than others, the value for money is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: RobSq
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great as was the staff. A little dated but charming and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Venice”
Reviews.Author: sja27
Reviews.Content: The hotel Luna is what you expect from a high end Venetian hotel. Other reviewers have summarized its attributes very well - private water taxi dock, perfect central location, terrific service, wonderful breakfast, very comfortable rooms, etc. When in Venice you walk as much as when in any city in Europe. Having a hotel located in the middle of everything is a blessing, especially when traveling with children. I would happily stay at Hotel Luna on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandr2
Reviews.Content: Very good location, convinient to get all the famous places. There is so noisy. Breakfast isn't good, we had to ask to bring everything, because there is not enough meal in bouffet.

Reviews.Title: “Waking up with the light of sunrise coming through the window”
Reviews.Author: Irene M
Reviews.Content: We bought our double room here together with our plane tickets through Expedia and got an excellent price. The hotel is located right behind San Marco Square, very close to the vaporetto stop, at the very centre of Venice. What to say of the hotel itself? Not only it is gorgeous, with rooms beautifully decorated in a barroque way, but from our room, facing the small public giardini next to the square, we could se the sun rise on the lagoon every morning and wake up in that spectacular light. Impeccable service. The people on the front desk are always very kind and helpful and every night we would find out a chocolate, the weather forecast for the next day and two bottles of mineral water (and our bed ready to be used) after we come back from having dinner. It couldn't feel more homely, at the same time than ellegant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugX50
Reviews.Content: The Luna is Baglioni,Venice is excellently located,right by San Marco square with access to grand cannal for water taxi from airport(100 euro.worth taking,as public taxis take ages ).Rates are quite high,but so is the whole Venice with good location.Service is top level here,although I would prefer to go out for dinner(ask concierge of where).Breakfast is ok. Rooms are nicely decorated.But with little view,as it is not fronting the cannal.Harry's bar is just around the corner.Its nice having a drink in the main squire in the evening at restaurants that have violin and jazz players.And early evening sitting opposite Harry's bar on river terrace sipping drinks watching the lights getting dark,or if you prefer,hire a singing gondola for a champagne ride.(bring your own drinks)

Reviews.Title: “By far the best place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PJordanUK
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel as a whole. A few yards from Piazza San Marco, and the Tiziano suite was..... astonishing ! Venice is really walkable, but the hotel's location made everything much easier. Had a few nice tips from the concierge as for the best place to buy original venetian glass :) The guy also booked us in a really nice seafood restaurant down the channel, which was amazing ! The suite we had prebooked was extremely nice, not so big, but luxorious to the very meaning of luxury !! A bit costly though- almost Â£700.00 for a night is a bit too much.... even though I would recommend the Baglioni for anyone who wants to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Far to be a Five Star”
Reviews.Author: emrodri
Reviews.Content: No air conditioning, very warm and stuffy rooms, even with a very mild outside temperature. Opening the windows only got things worse, the rooms were swarming with mosquitos (some were already in there). We were told we were in one of the coolest rooms. The hotel is very, very expensive for what it offers. The only good thing is the location, close to San Marco square.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: HannuMikael
Reviews.Content: Arrival to Venice is a bit of a mission, but after managing to get onboard on vaporetto (water bus in Venice) at Piazzale Roma, rest is easy with Hotel Luna Baglioni. It's because of the location just few steps from the San Marco Vallaresso water bus stop. We were welcomed by very kind receptionist and quickly shown our way to the room on 4th floor. Nicely decorated and quite spacious room had amazing view and balcony facing the Giardinetti Ex-Reali garden and Canale di San Marco. On the other direction you could see the alley with some luxury boutiques and loads of tourists. All in all the hotel was very beautifully decorated and well kept. We asked a help from Concierge to find us a nice dining place and he suggested (and made reservation to) very good and original Italian restaurant Al Paradiso. Just a 15 minutes walk to Rialto bridge and few steps by the canal and there it was, one of the best dining experiences ever. Breakfast was good, but not amazing. Good selection of high quality ingredients. Nothing bad to say about this very nice hotel with kind and polite staff. They really have the package well in place and such a great location close to everything that matters in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “2 days at the Hotel Luna Baglioni”
Reviews.Author: PNathanson01
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Hotel Luna Baglioni by water taxi was quite a treat. It's beautiful-- even though the staff showed up AFTER we lugged all of our suitcases up to the lobby door from the boat. We had lunch in the bar area while we waited for our suite to be made up. The selection was varied and the waiter was very nice. The bar was sunken and decorated with dark wood and rich fabrics. We ordered A mixed antipasto salad, Chicken salad club sandwich with french fries, a mozzarella and tomato sandwich, and a few ice cold caffe fredos that were shaken in a cocktail shaker. The food was delicious and the portions were generous! Our room was one of the penthouse suites--Suite Giorgione. The room was two levels with a large master bedroom upstairs. Also upstairs were two bathrooms (one with an exercise bike), a large walk in closet, and a terrace/deck with a tented table, a pair of chaise lounges, plenty of fresh lavender and rosemary, and a KILLER view of the grand canal and St. Mark's Square. The room was really comfortable and the terrace was a delight. We were only there for 2 nights and I wish that it could have been longer. Breakfast in the main ballroom was excellent. It was probably the best selection that we had found out of all the hotels we stayed in on our trip. Croissants, cereals, tons of breads, cheeses, meats, sweets and cakes, eggs, juices, etc. Friendly staff. The only downside to the hotel were the people at the front desk and the concierge staff. Venice is very difficult to navigate. They were quick to give us several maps, but did not really care to give us accurate directions or show us what we were really asking for. Went on a wild goose chase to find a certain venetian mask workshop and never found it. They need to realize that guests are going to do touristy things and they need to be accommodating even if they disagree with the guest's choices. Overall, it was a good experience and I would probably stay there again for the location and comfort level.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, upscale historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glen S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and throughly enjoyed ourselves. The hotel is beautiful and full of venetian charm. The restaruants are excellent and the buffet breakfast is a good value given the multitude of choices (even gluten free options!). Our deluxe room was very spacious, but was the 4th room shown to us as the previous one's lacked either the view we had booked or had furnishings in need of updating. The staff was very helpful and recommended several outstanding restaurants for us, many of which represented the best food in Venice. It's location among the finest shops in Venice and directly behind a vaporetto stop made this hotel a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible 1000 year old property”
Reviews.Author: ncarmine
Reviews.Content: Met up with our Perillo Tour here (we had arrived 2 days earlier). Imagine arriving at your hotel in a water taxi! Beautiful reception area, great help at the front desk, spacious, clean room. Sumptuous decor throughout, and the most amazing breakfast room ever...it was the ballroom of this former single-family home. Only one warning...bring your soda in from a supermercado or a vending machine...I paid 7 Euros for a Coke Zero at the bar..that's about $9.80 U.S. Although, I must admit, it was beautifully served by the bartender, on the little tables by the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: janmac50
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay could not have been better. The hotel sparkles! We are still dreaming of the wonderful breakfasts in the elegant salon. Everything you need is nearby, Piazza San Marco, shopping, restaurants. The staff warmly welcomed us from the moment we stepped off the water taxi from the airport. We looked forward to stopping for a glass of wine on the canalside terrace each afternoon on the way back from our excursions. Venice is magical, day and night and you will love the Luna Hotel Baglioni for your home here.

Reviews.Title: “Ho hum”
Reviews.Author: mark121
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a grand tour of Italy. So, I'll start this review by saying that we arrived on the Orient Express and also stayed in the Hotel Relais dell'Orologio in Pisa, the Hassler Hotel in Rome and Il San Pietro in Positano. All the hotels that we stayed in had free WiFi, which was very nice change from UK hotels! At the Luna, we had a beautiful suite (Sandro Botticelli) with large rooms and a view to St Mark's tower from the sitting room and a small balcony off the bedroom, which had a narrow view across the grand canal. The bed was comfortable but had rather rough sheets on it. They felt more like the sheets you would find on a hospital bed rather than in a five star hotel. They were probably some sort of very posh material and I'm simply showing my ignorance but the sheets were not to my liking. Altogether I found the place rather charmless. Apart from the reception/concierge staff, the rest of the staff were a fairly disinterested lot. My biggest gripe was breakfast. This is served in an enormous and fabulous room. However, it's a clinical buffet affair with stressed-looking, overworked staff. The hotel caters for large groups and when they all descend on breakfast together, the staff find it very difficult to keep up. On our first morning, the coffee was cold. We didn't ask for fresh, since that would have taken too long. There was a good choice of buffet items but I think you'd still be waiting if you'd ordered eggs to be cooked for you. It was not the sort of experience I would expect from a hotel like this. The hotel bar is very bland and the waiter was much more interested in doing something else behind the scenes rather than waiting on tables and taking orders. I left the place rather underwhelmed (even more so, after having to have a cold shower on the last morning). So, not a place to which I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Yes and no”
Reviews.Author: philbody
Reviews.Content: The initial greeting by the reception staff was good and the hotel was very central and pleasant in a gracious older style.Our room however was terrible only one small side window in stained glass that ddi not open more tha a few inches and was opposite a wall .The room was very dark and gloomy with no natural daylight at all, it was clean and well presented but an airless prison cell .We requested another room but was told the hotel was full this was not the room we had booked shoulders were shrugged.After a terrible night were we had numerous insect bites and after much strongly worded discussion we were moved to a much better room with windows and light .However the room was not prefect with a leaking shower and mould in shower .The breakfast was good but in general we were very disaponted.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Trip”
Reviews.Author: JB1981London
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 3 nights at the Luna Baglioni...... We were celebrating a special occassion so were given an upagrade to a canal view suite which was absolutely amazing. Large bed, large bathroom & great decor not to mention what i'm sure is the best view in Venice.The hotel itself is in a fantastic location, just steps from San Marco square, designer shops and the famous Harry's bar. Breakfast was an absolute highlight, in a beautiful large dinning room, with a good selection of 'english breakfast' items as well as lots of pastries to tempt you. We didn't use the hotel bar, prefering to sit outside in the Grand Monaco hotel next door but i'm sure in the cooler months the Luna Baglioni bar would be an excellent place for a pre dinner cocktail. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel in venice, ignore the Danieli and Bauer hotels and book the faultless Luna Baglioni.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, pleasant, intimate and wonderfully located hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgpaley
Reviews.Content: To deal with the possible negatives first, this hotel may have some small and poor-view rooms. We stayed in the Giorgone Suite was is sumptuous and has views of the lagoon from the bedroom and the lovely sun deck. That said, every hotel I've stayed at in Venice (Gritti Palace, Cipriani, Danieli, Londra Palace, now here) has some magnificent rooms and some really crummy rooms. In this town, if you want a good view, you pay for it. This hotel doesn't have the sheer glamour of reputation of the Danieli, for example, but there are a few things to consider. My daughter stayed at the Danieli this past June. Both for check-in and check-out there were long lines of people waiting, one person working very slowly, and multiple other hotel employees standing around chatting. Even at busiest times, I never waited more than a minute or two for what was always careful attention at the Luna Baglioni. I also certainly had no problem getting porters to take care of my bags. Another thing is breakfast. The breakfast buffet at the Danieli was decent, but the cooked egg dishes were often mediocre. Breakfast here was sumptuous (and overseen by a very pleasant and heartily cheerful woman who really went out of her way to make sure guests were well tended to and happy) and the omelets I had and fried eggs my partner had were really excellent. The brioche and croissants here were also top quality, as were the meats, fruits and cheeses as well as the coffee. The breakfast room and main restaurant are beautiful in the old Venetian style; the breakfast room covered in lavish murals and local glass chandeliers. The furnishings in our room were also classic Venetian but in no way old or run-down and the bathroom facilities (shower, etc.) were modern and worked very well. For me, the location is absolutely the best. You don't have the crowd situation that you do in front of the Danieli or Londra Palace, but you are RIGHT THERE for Piazza San Marco. The only downside to the location is that you are dangerously close to expensive and tempting shopping (Loro Piana, Bottega Veneta). Even given the possible variability of the rooms, which we didn't experience, I'm going to rate this high for value because of the location and the service. They have a dock that leads out onto the main lagoon on one side, which means you can arrange water taxi service right to the hotel. You can also walk a very short stretch to the main San Marco vaporetto stop. No score on their spa (I actually didn't get around to paying attention to whether they have one) because I just didn't get to it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: nancy g
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 2 nights and it was lovely! The Hotel was quiet and lavish and beautiful. Definitely 5-star! Our room was ready when we arrived in the morning which we really appreciated and we were upgraded to a Junior suite which was a wonderful surprise and really fun. The location is amazing. It is right off St Marks Square , but so quiet you would never know it. It is also right off the Grand Canal. The Breakfast Room was stunning and the food was very good. The Hotel was really beautiful. Everything was perfect. We felt very pampered and had a wonderful stay. The only note was that the Concierge was not very helpful. We asked him a few small questions and he was rather short and didn't give us much information, he made us feel we were bothering him so we knew that was not going to be an avenue we could use which was a shame. That is one of the services you usually like to tap into when traveling. So we used other avenues for recommendations. All else was perfect and we would be thrilled to return at some point.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: travellingfamily222
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel located around the cornder from the heart of San Marco Square. Very easy to find right off the ferry boat. The location was perfect, the view was amazing, overlooking the little canals and the walkways of venice. The hotel offered a delicious breakfast buffet. Hotel was extremely clean and very comfortable. Decorated in old-venetian style, making us all feel like royalty. Well worth the amount to stay comfortably. We will definately be back and highly recommend this hotel to anyone that plans to visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Cool...”
Reviews.Author: cjseashore
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Luna. My husband and I were on our way to a cruise ship. August is holiday time in Europe and it was insanely crowded and HOT. I payed particular attention to how the air conditioning functioned in this hotel via reviews...When we arrived, all sweated up, we opened the doors of the street's back entrance to the hotel and were flooded with cool air... The Luna is elegant and the front entrance is very beautiful...located right on the water with many people photographing the hotel's front entrance. I noticed that the video of our cruise, which one could purchase on the ship, opened with the entrance of the hotel in a scene of Venice. We were upgraded to a junior suite. The room was lovely in a very Italian, the old streets of Venice style. The lighting of the room is dim in the evening. However, one feels like they have entered the ancient world and that was cool. The bathroom was absolutely wonderful. It was huge and there was a claw footed tub (which was so nice to use after a looong flight). The shower had a overhead, rain type showerhead. The lightening was very bright in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and I did so enjoy the toothy, cotton sheets. I do not like the sateen type sheets. The air conditioning flawless. At, night the room was really, really quiet....not a sound heard... We had a lot of little issues and the hotel staff was receptive and really helpful...Thank you to all. The breakfast was presented in an large, ornate room. If anyone has any complaints about it and the large offerings of food and beverage, that would mystify me.. This hotel is not inexpensive. However, for a splurge and for the wonderful cool air it was worth every penny. For those who are game for a less expensive trip from the airport to the hotel and can haul their luggage over a few steps....We took the Alilaguna water bus to San Marco Square. Exit the airport baggage pick up area and turn left...follow the covered walkway for about 7-10 min. walk until one reaches the water taxis ( approx. 150 us dollars deposits one in the front entrance of the hotel ) or go on to the waterbus area (approx 32 Euro for two). They will tell one which waterbus to take to San Marco Square. It is a long ride. It will deposit one at the San Marco dock. jump off of the boat, turn left walk up the steps and down the steps..turn R at the first "street" walk until you see the hotel on your R...From the dock it takes about 3 min....have fun

Reviews.Title: “Venetian approach”
Reviews.Author: madinadubai
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Luna Baglioni was quite short. Let me share my experience with you... The location of the hotel is great, as You are in the very center and all destinations are accessible. You might not be lucky with the location of your room, which can overlook the stairs or concrete wall of the opposite building, which you can almost touch with your hand. The staff approach at this hotel depends,I guess, on their mood and they can be ignorant and just not friendly; concierge rarely takes care of your luggage with which you should struggle on your own, as they (obviously) pretend not seeing you. The shower in our room was splashing in all possible directions, so you might have a dilemma of staying not fresh or having a pond in your bathroom... The tiny room is overloaded with unnecessare furniture and the window is always must be kept close (remember those stairs opposite your window), so claustrofobic person must stay away. There was some kind of exposition of old outfit above the ''lobby'' area. There are also some pieces of furniture next to the stairs on which you are not alowed to sit...

Reviews.Title: “tim and mandie mulloy”
Reviews.Author: tim m
Reviews.Content: what a fantastic hotel the best we have ever stayed in service second to nonefood in restaurant is fab well worth booking at least on meal there while in venice

Reviews.Title: “Wowed”
Reviews.Author: Socontent
Reviews.Content: Started in Venice ~ our first stop of a 2 week journey through Italy. I was wowed at the interior, enjoyed the charm, blown away by the extraordinary breakfast offerings and felt like I'd won the lottery to be staying in four of the Baglioni properties. Baglioni + all things Italy made my head nearly explode! Loved loved loved loved it. Venice, Florence, Balogna, Siena, ... (thank you God for the blessings of being able to do such a thing).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidFranklin8
Reviews.Content: First time in Venice and we feel we picked the best place to stay. We had a Junior Suite which was perfect, we had to go up to the 2nd floor and back down 2 filghts of stairs, so check before you book if you dont like doing stairs. The Hotel is right next to St Marks Square and we loved nipping out in the morning and evening when less people were out and enjoyed a long siesta back at the hotel. We could see the Grand Canal when we stuck our heads out of the window but no rooms face directly onto it anyway. Arriving from the airport and directly to the hotel was great especially when we watched people dragging their suitcases around the back streets trying to find their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best dinner of our lives!”
Reviews.Author: Martinj911
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate our 31 year anniversary and to renew our wedding vows in Venice! We stayed in the Tiepolo Grand Lagoon Suite and it was absolutely fabulous! Two separate rooms, a bedroom and living room separated by double doors for privacy. Both rooms were very large and beautifully furnished. A very large bathroom with double sinks and a tub/shower combination. The terrace was absolutely perfect and was larger than the room. It overlooked the grand canal with beautiful views! The most impressive thing about this hotel was their food and beverage manager, Rami Hamam! I had arranged a surprise private dinner and wine pairing on our terrace of the suite with Mr. Hamam prior to arriving in Venice. Mr. Hamam arranged for a harpist to play for us, had two servers that waited on us for our every need AND he himself greeted us and stayed with us throughout the entire evening to ensure that everything was perfect! The food and the wine were excellent and the service was absolutely outstanding! Thanks to Mr. Hamam, my husband and I renewed our wedding vows in the perfect place, with a perfect meal, beautiful music and perfect service! We will definitely return to this hotel. If you can afford it, stay in the Tiepolo Suite but DEFINITELY ask for Mr. Hamam if you visit their restaurant or have any special requests! He is sure to make your dreams come true!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and views without being overrun by Americans”
Reviews.Author: cbreezedad
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. Both times we had a suite with a terrace. The suite is gorgeous- all silk wallpaper, Murano chandeliers, venetian artwork and classic furnishings. The terrace was approximately 1000 square feet! In Venice no less!! And looking out on the Campanile at St. Mark's square, a quiet park, the and the Grand Canal. The hotel is 50 yards from St. Mark's but a direction no tourist goes, so it is incredibly quiet and secluded! The staff speak passable English adding to the ambience. Americans have not discovered the hotel in masses yet making it even better. The staff are very accomodating. My wife does not want me to post this review because she does not want it becoming overrun. It is in the nicest part of Venice by all the best shops and 5 minutes walk from excellent local restaurants (Canova is the hotel's gourmet restaurant ). To sum up, the hotel has the best views, the largest terrace, the quietest and best location of any hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sixpalz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our Tauck tour and were not disappointed. Our room was well appointed and the amenities were good. Everything was completely restocked at evening turn-down. When the electicity blew out in our room they were very prompt to move us to another room. Be aware that if you have laundry done at the hotel that it is extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Our brilliant stay at the Luna Baglioni”
Reviews.Author: victorianunes
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and was a honeymoon. We both thought the Luna Baglioni was amongst the nicest hotels in Venice, with a beautiful very central location. For keen shoppers it is located at the heart of the designer shopping area, and is also near many restauarants and bars. The room was really beautiful and traditional in decor and was well maintained by housekeeping. If I were to return to Venice I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “superb location but needs work”
Reviews.Author: Cava123
Reviews.Content: Next to St. Marks yet quiet. Opulent in the manner of the traditional European "Grand Hotel". The standard rooms are minimal dimension and a bit tired. If you want to stay in this area, I would choose this or the Bauer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Compassionate & Considerate Hotel, Assisted me in our time of severe need”
Reviews.Author: mrlax
Reviews.Content: I am writing a review of this hotel although I was not actually able to stay there. My wife and I had booked Luna Hotel Baglioni as well as several other hotels in other parts of Italy for our honeymoon. Just two weeks after our wedding at the end of April, my wife was diagnosed with a severe internal ailment which required surgery and completely forced the cancellation of our entire honeymoon. With less than 3 weeks notice in advance of our arrival, the management of this hotel provided me with a complete refund. Although part of our payment was non-refundable, they were able to 'bend' their policy to provide us with full return of our funds in this severe time of need. We tremendously appreciate this gesture and cannot thank them enough for their consideration in a time of severe challenge and need for my wife, myself, and our families. While this may seem 'normal' for a hotel to provide a refund under such dire extenuating circumstances, we have been completely screwed by another hotel in Italy, specifically on Sardinia, called 'Faro Capo Spartivento', an alleged 'world class' 5 star hotel. I provided them with 25 days notice and the circumstances of our cancellation, yet they have with-held more than 1400 euro from me and refuse to communicate whatsoever with me and provide me with any rationale why. So in summary, I want to provide the utmost confidence that Luna Hotel Baglioni is run by very good, conscientious, and respectful management, and I hope to stay there at a point in the future when my wife's recovery allows. Thank-you for reading my review and I would be happy to answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and service just a step away from St. Marks Square.”
Reviews.Author: PKARRA-Vacationers
Reviews.Content: We recetly stayed in the Luna Hotel Baglioni while traveling through Italy for our 25th wedding anniversary. Of all of the hotels we stayed in during the trip, this was the most luxurious. It is a true full service luxury hotel with a great deal of attention spent on service. When we arrived, they first upgraded us to a suite (from a junior suite), and our room was pure luxury. The hotel represents Venice well - there are apparently two buildings tied together to make one so that our room was on floor 4 and a half and we had to walk up a small flight of stairs to get to it. However, the room was really 4 rooms and was beautiful and comfortable. The bedroom was the quietest, darkest, most comfortable room we found in Italy. Truly luxurious bed (the most comfortable we found in two weeks)! The bathroom was beautiful. Also, the staff were very attentive. The first night we arrived, the internet was not working nor was our phone. However, the staff helped us by giving us access to a private phone, and the problem was fixed by the next morning. The internet was very slow which was the one frustration. If doing business while in Italy is important to you, this may not be the place for you. We could not get Skype to work because of the connection. However, everything else about the hotel was awesome. In addition, the hotel is 20 steps from St. Marks Square so it is very convenient. It is also just steps from the San Marco Vaparetto stop and has a private canal for private taxis or gondola rides. We didn't use the restaurants, but there were multiple restaurants available. In general, you can't go wrong at the Luna Hotel if you are looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Time”
Reviews.Author: grcampbell2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an amazing stay at the Luna Baglioni. We stayed in a Junior Suite for 3 nights and it was just perfect. Our room was beautiful, the food was delicious and all the staff were absolutely wonderful and went out of their way to make every moment of our stay special. We were celebrating my 50th birthday and was delighted with the complimentary bottle of champage from the hotel (it went down a treat)! Our only regret was that our stay was not long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vik12
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great I stay for two nights celebrating a wedding anniversary great location . The only cons was the breakfast for 40 euro per person I believe it is overpriced compare with the small variety when you pay 500 euro per night the breakfast should be included

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better”
Reviews.Author: cleminternet
Reviews.Content: I should start off by saying that we booked the cultural package direct with the hotel and on arrival part of the deal was a free upgrade if availability allowed. We were greeted by a very friendly staff having taken the boat taxi direct from the airport to the hotel entrance. Although we had to wait for an hour for the 'room' to be prepared, which the receptionist suggested was worth the wait, we were taken to the top floor (5th) and shown to our 'suite'. Wow, an uninterrupted view directly looking onto the Grand Canal. The accommodation was stunning. Sofas and wing chairs, writing tables, leading through an arch to the bedroom and dressing room, most beautifully furnished in 19th century style. We had an exercise bike and three TV's (not that we watched any TV of course). The bathroom was equipped with the biggest marble shower, a free standing bath and a double sink unit. The window on this side overlooked the bell tower in St Mark's square. Indeed this hotel was close to everything. Harry's Bar 30 metres away as is the square itself. Valparetto (river transport) stop is also very close. Breakfast was included in the package and there simply was everything you could wish for. The one dinner (included in the package)we had at the hotel was very high end. Four courses (excluding beverages) of beautifully cooked food. My wife and I did look at the double room that we might have stayed in had we not been upgraded and would we still have been ecstatic - most definitely. A hotel with true class. Wew'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: RichLI
Reviews.Content: What can I say a perfect hotel in a perfect location. Steps away from St Marks and adjacent to Harry's bar. The room was beautiful a little small....No View at all....Upon arrival we were helped by a very young desk clerk, she was very very new, her supervisor could see I was getting a little frustrated and stepped in, we flew over night from New York and arrived very early, at first they said our room was not going to be ready for several hours, I asked if they could do better and they said they would try, we stepped out for about 1/2 hours and upon returning the room was ready, the staff was great very helpful, I strongly reccomend your take the stairs down at some point because the lobbies on each floor are impressive. There are no words to describe the breakfast room so I will paste a picture, i'm a little tired so I know this review rambles a little, but this hotel is so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, excellent luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: marielaleong
Reviews.Content: Made for an unforgetable honeymoon, the hotel is gorgeous and the service is great. Located steps away from all the must see places.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Luxury to the extreme!”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaG-77
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in and I have stayed in a lot of nice hotels. The front desk staff was always lovely and made us feel very welcome!

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: petiteblondie
Reviews.Content: Travelled on the Orient Express to Venice and stayed at the luna for three nights.The room was standard but really beautiful, padded silk walls,canopy bed, huge sofa and big mirrored wardrobes. Bathroom was also huge all white marble. Staff were very nice especially the bar staff.The position of the hotel is superb just one minute from St Mark's square , but yet very quiet.Breakfast was very good, dinner average, so we only ate in for one night .We had considered the Cipriani but decided the boat journey to the main island too much for a three night stay, we were glad we chose the Luna and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: dharland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the BEST. The staff are so helpfull and friendly. Nothing is a problem and your requests are actioned NOW!! FABULOUS!! Not stiff at all bearing in mind it's 5 star. The position is spot on and easy to get to and find. You must bear in mind there are NO ROADS, I saw a lot of people trailing round Venice with suitcases trying to. find there hotel. A good tip is to get off the water bus at St. Marks, go into the first hotel and ask, it was so easy.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Sigucis
Reviews.Content: overpriced, terrible attitude towards the guest, do not know know the meaning of the hospitality, restaurant closes early and on top of that, when arriving late from the party i was asked to show my identity "in order to protect my bf"!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Luna Hotel Baglioni Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cymro_un
Reviews.Content: In March 2011, my wife and I were extremely fortunate to stay at the Five Star Deluxe Luna Hotel Baglioni in Venice. The holiday which was arranged by Citalia could not have been better. Although our hotel was changed at the last minute, the reception we received at the Luna Hotel was excellent. We were fortunate to be there for the last two days of the Carnival, and during our stay it was my wife's birthday. On her birthday, the Hotel provided us with a bottle of prosecco in our very comfortable room. The room, which had a safe, was very comfotrable and there were some built in wardrobes for storage, and the walls of the room were covered with slik wall hangings. The Hotel is situated directly off St. Mark's Square and has it's own boat jetty outside, the stop for the Alilaguna ferry transfer from the airport is on the Grand Canal and literally a couple of hundred yards from the hotel. The only meals that we took in the Hotel were the breakfasts, which were sumptous, and the setting was in a beautiful room, which had some magnificent Tiepolo paintings on the ceiling. The staff were excellent througout and always extremely friendly and helpful. As we were on a bargain break we did not have much of a view from our room, but we could see above us there was at least one room which had a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. This was our second stay in Venice and we never expected to be able to visit during the extremely busy and colourful Carnival, with many splendid costumes and acts being on display. As the holiday took place at Carnival time we saw many of the amazing sights and sounds of the event, and we also had good weather during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great location, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MCCarvalho
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Venice with our two kids to celebrate the birthday of our daughter. The Luna hotel was a great place to stay. Great location, a step from San Marco and by the canal with gondolas and taxis at your footsteps. Our rooms were splendidly decorated, with fancy finishings and a wonderful bathroom with double sinks and plenty of amenities and towels. The rooms are indeed a bit hot, but there are limitations to what one can expect in this old old city, just a small crack in the window and we were fine. The staff was very kind and arranged for a lovely dinner at their restaurant - they even baked a special cake for our kid and sang happy birthday with us. We got complimentary fruit , drinks (try the Bellini) and divine chocolates. Front desk staff was very happy and spoke English and Portuguese (!). The breakfast saloon is beautiful and the selections tasteful, they even get special treats for the little kids, not something easily found in Europe. They sent someone to pick us up at the train station and moved us to the hotel quite easily. We would gladly come back and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL, PERFECT LOCATION.”
Reviews.Author: dave083
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in the Luna Baglioni for 3 nights, on arrival we were met from our water Taxi by the very helpful staff, we were then upgraded to a Junior Suite which was beautiful and a good size. All the staff were very attentive and extremely helpful. The hotel is in the best location in Venice. Had a superb stay and a wonderful month to see Venice.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want to Feel Like Royalty, the Luna Baglioni is the Place for You”
Reviews.Author: kwjp79
Reviews.Content: The Luna Baglioni may be expensive, but if you're looking to splurge then it is definitely worth it. It's Venice's oldest - and from what we saw best - hotel. The ornate decor, historic grand ballroom and impeccable service take you back in time and make you feel like royalty, while the modern amenities make it convenient and comfortable. The staff were amazing and went out of their way to help us with things like a mistake with a rental car booking, reservations for water taxis, etc. The location right around the corner from St. Mark's Square and in the heart of Venice's historic cultural and shopping district can't be beat. The perfect place to get away from it all and really treat yourselves to something special. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “if you're going to splurge, this is the place that's worth it”
Reviews.Author: leftylanigan
Reviews.Content: Right around the corner from St. Mark's Basilica. If you turn the other direction, you're in a neighborhood of charming shops and little, non-touristy restaurants and cafes. The rooms are sumptuous and quiet. The people on the desk are friendly and incredibly helpful. The breakfast buffet is brilliant and the bar overlooking the lagoon cozy. Worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our cozy room”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanA-Z
Reviews.Content: We started our trip to italy with three nights in Venice and chose this hotel because of its location and reputation. We had a confortable stay. Our room had no view but it was so quiet and cozy that made up for a great spot to rest and get some good sleep. The beds and pillows were very comfortable with very fine linens. There was a TV as well threatening to take us out of the room and I am proud to say that we never turned it on. The spacious bathroom was my favorite part of the room, with a large size shower head and a towel rack warmer inside the shower area. Very good quality towels and bathrobes, and plenty of decent quality toiletries as well. The staff was very helpful making phone calls and reservations for us when needed. My only observation on the staff is that they could be a little more friendly. Just smile a little bit... it goes further than you think! Public and private water transportation access is within few meters of the hotel. There were also 2 surprises: one good and the other bad. The good surprise is that the Restaurant Canova at the hotel is excellent. We went to few other restaurants for lunch and dinner and the restaurant at the hotel was the best one of all. The bad surprise is that the" free trip" to Murano Glass Factory is a scam. If i was the owner of this hotel I would never put my guest in such an uncomfortable situation. i was interested in seeing process of glass making and asked in the front desk about the tour to the island and how to book it. The person in the desk told me that every half hour there is a boat that takes guest from the hotel and to just let him know when I would like to go. About how much is the trip for two? I asked. "There is a promotion on going for guests of our hotel and we are offering the trip at no charge." No charge? I asked in disbelief. "Yes, no charge". He replied Later that morning my husband and I were in a private boat going to the island. When we got there, there was a very brief show of the process of glass making because all the workers were on vacation- they told us- and we didn't see what we went to see. Sooner than wished there was this sales person taking us through the showrooms and pushing really hard for us to buy something. He claimed that he had seeing my eyes go big after viewing a Veronese style water jar on one of the shelves and he was ready to negotiate: the original price for that particular piece was E. 4,900.00 but, since I was staying at this hotel, I would get a discount of 50%, bringing the price down to E. 2,450.00 which he thought was a good deal. I told him very clear that I was not interested. Then he went to speak to another black suit man and he said he got an even better deal on the same item: E. 1,550.00 I had to be very straight forward and harsh at times to get rid of them and I knew that my ride back to the hotel was in their hands. Not a good situation to be in. i had to be very strong and hated the concierge that had set this trip up without giving us a full version of what it was. i wasn't looking for a free ride to Murano, he offered it as a promotion from the hotel, not from the Murano glass company. We didn't buy anything and it felt so good to be in the boat on our way back to the hotel. Oops! they brought us back to the Sn. Marco square this time. This confirms the say: "when it sounds too good to be true, it generally is"

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was quite an fabulous experiance”
Reviews.Author: JSZS
Reviews.Content: Our family came and stayed for 3 nights and absolutely loved the hotel. The rooms were amazing and very elegantly decorated. The beds were extremely comfortable, the service was absolutly amazing, and the breakfast wasalso superb. The hotel even went to the next level giving complementary slippers and chocolates.To conclude, the staff was very helpful and kind to us, making sure we had the best stay possible. Our time at the Luna Baglioni was excellent. I would without any question recommend this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerSA101
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Luna for 3 nights - world-class experience!! Just prior to our trip in Venice we stayed in a 5 star hotel in Rome but Hotel Luna was 2 notches higher at 50% of the price !! The staff know how to run a hotel and created the whole experience... from the classy bar with its proud barman, theatre tickets, to the day trip they organized to Murano and Burano islands (probably one of the best kept secrets in Venice). It will come back to hotel again & again. Well done Hotel Luna.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like King and Queen”
Reviews.Author: MeAndMyBetterHalf
Reviews.Content: 5+++++ Stars!!!! It was our 4th wedding anniversary, and the General Manager seemed to have everything arranged beautifully! I never met the General Manager, but my wife and I did meet the Hotel Manager who was so kind and even gave a gift to my wife when we were leaving. The Hotel staff were so pleasant as well. The room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel even upgraded us at no charge. The Buffet breakfast for very "elegant". Again the stafff made us feel they were truly working for us. We felt so pampered! If you want a romantic hotel extremely close to St. Mark's square, this is it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rude and disrespectful staff”
Reviews.Author: WorldinHand
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and do not recommend the Luna Hotel Baglioni. The reception staff cut us off while we were speaking, did not take time for our concerns and hardly somebody behind the reception desk seemed to speak and/ or understand English. The rooms do not meet maintenance requirements; coverlets come with holes -- definitely not a 5-star-niveau!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, quiet, rococo”
Reviews.Author: binmadrid
Reviews.Content: We had booked in the Monaco & Grand Canal next door but were moved to this hotel for 1 of the 2 nights. No complaints there, a huge room overlooking the canal and backing on to St Marks Square. Decor not really to our taste, brocaded walls, floor length drapes, very rococo. But very comfortable and superb location. Good breakfast in magnificent setting. One small gripe: there was a wood fire burning in the salon downstairs and the smell of smoke seemed to get everywhere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Cathendo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for a day and a half prior to joining the Orient Express. After a smooth transition from the airport by boat we arrived at the hotel. We were warmly greeted and our bags brought into the hotel. Reception staff were attentive. Because we arrived before our room was ready, we decided to go out and about to explore. Our room was still not quite ready but we were given complimentary refreshments in the bar while we waited. Our bedroom had a side view of the canal below and had a small balcony. The room was elegantly furnished and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was functional. Towels were replaced at turndown and there were bathrobes and slippers provided. Toiletries were of a good standard. All the staff were very helpful. Like some other reviewers we thought the restaurant very expensive and decided to eat out. The concierge recommended a local eating place and booked it for us. We found this hotel to be very well placed with regards to tourism. It is just round the corner from St. Marks Square and the Doges Palace. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The truest luxury is service......”
Reviews.Author: PassportInPurse
Reviews.Content: From the moment I was greeted to the final arrivederci, my stay at this hotel was wonderful. I had stayed at it before, but this was my first time traveling solo. The staff could not have been more charming and genuinely helpful. My room was fabulous, overlooking the canal. When my flights were cancelled two days in a row, the hotel accommodated me so graciously I could not believe it. The location is perfect, tucked away behind St. Mark's square, and water taxi will deliver you from the airport right up to the door of the hotel. It is a wonderful way to experience Venice. I will always return to the Luna Hotel (but I won't give up the number of the room I had--it was amazing!).

Reviews.Title: “A tremendous value next to St. Marks Square”
Reviews.Author: Galway1
Reviews.Content: We had a large group who needed to stay near St. Marks' Square because of mobility issues and limited time to tour before a cruise. This is a first class hotel, no more than 50 yards from St. Marks' with a very helpful staff. The rates are low compared to like properties farther away from St Marks. The rooms were large and nicely appointed. Because the hotel is on a canal, transportation to the cruise ship was easy to accomplish (not cheap, but easy). The restaurant was outrageously expensive but the staff had suggestions for nearby places that were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We would come back to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Concordia100
Reviews.Content: Our best overrol experience in Venice so far. Exellent location friendly staff room small but everything you need is provided (exept for a desk if you need to work). Internet ( at least in our price bracket was included). Good bed. Goog breakfast buffet. Dinning room restaurant very good but slow service.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: md7
Reviews.Content: hope one day to return. hotel beautiful food outstanding , location perfect, very lovely very warm , this hotel can be summed up in 1 word - quality hope to return one day , a very special place

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: ceekaye16
Reviews.Content: The easiest way to describe this very beautiful hotel is to say that this is the kind of place where the staff smiles very nicely at you and wishes you a beautiful day, all while watching you struggle to get your bags through the door.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: gonzo1224
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff at the Luna Hotel Baglioni is exceptional! We were warmly greeted from the moment we first stepped into the hotel. All the front desk staff speak English fluently. Our luggage was lost by the airline for 2.5 days and the front desk personnel called the airport four times a day each day for us checking on the status of the bags. They recommended places to go, things to do and taught us how to use the public transportation system. Room service was excellent. The food was served on huge silver trays. All the staff acknowledged us always. Breakfast was included. It was plentiful and delicious! Our room was extremely clean and comfortable. And the view! Wow! The location of the hotel is A+++. You have immediate access to St. Marks Square and are surrounded by the finest designer shops in the world (Gucci, Loro Piana, Botegga Venetta, Chanel, etc.). The public water taxi stop is right outside the back door to the left. You will not be disappointed with this property. It is very customer service oriented! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KMItaly2010
Reviews.Content: True Venetian hotel in an excellent location next to St. Mark's square. Friendly and helpful staff. Room was large but could use some refreshing. Breakfast is expensive if not included in the room price. Private dock was convenient for our departure to the airport. Welcome plate of sweets upon arrival was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: EnglandCaroline
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: Ksma23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Luna Baglioni for two nights before a cruise that departed from Venice. We were upgraded to a suite which was absolutely lovely with spectacular views. We found the staff to be attentive and eager to help with any request we had from arranging car service, a private sight seeing tour, meal reservations, and even an after hours gondola ride. British Airways lost our luggage and they the desk staff took care of the details and dealt with the airlines on our behalf. It is a beautiful property and the location is ideal. There is no question that the Luna Baglioni is the only hotel we'd consider upon returning to Venice. Price wise it is a bit higher but you get what you pay for. My only negative would be the breakfast buffet at 40 euros per person. I think there were many other comparable options in the surrounding area available for much less money. All in all a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid building ... woeful service”
Reviews.Author: SMACheshire
