Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that arriving at the Baglioni by water taxi is an uplifting experience. The hotel is in a superb location with its front entrance being no more than 20 yards from one corner of St Marks Square. The interior of the hotel is quite magnificent and every bedroom is gloriously furnished and decorated. There is however a downside. The hotel staff were less than efficient. The front desk was understaffed and everything seemed to be far too much of an effort. The indifference of the staff meant that there was little evidence of any forward planning or any willingness to use initiative to resolve elementary difficulties linked to checking in or out or finding somewhere to accomodate guests who were struggling with the wait . The breakfast was hugely disappointing, particularly the dreadful offerings in the cooked section. Much of what was available was not fit for consumption and certainly should not have featured in a so-called five star establishment. The staff in the dining room were lacking in charm and chose to ignore guests who dared to point to deficiences rather than look for ways of improving the service. Anyone considering paying the premium prices being asked by the hotel should be prepared to enjoy the the location and the decor, but eat to elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A true Venetian Palace near St Marco's Square”
Reviews.Author: SalseroBrazil
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a Junior suite, very clean and spacious on the second floor. Breakfast is quite expensive if you do not reserve by WEB. Concierge and staff at the Hotel are polite and made all arrengments for Opera, walking tours and they can provide a tour to Murano every day. Restaurant is one of the best in Venice. The Hotel is a few steps from St Marco's Squares and Harry's Bar. You can reach Luna Baglioni by water taxi directly from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “USELESS RESERVATIONS, NEED MAINTENANCE”
Reviews.Author: MariaElen
Reviews.Content: I'm writing again my review for this Hotel because someone has taken my previous review away. We stayed for a week in the rooms the staff had decided to give us in spite of our confirmed reservations. They ignored the kind of rooms we had booked in advanced. They lied to us offering a supposed "upgrade" that wasn't really a superior category, it was just the only rooms available. They made us waste a lot of time in the Lobby, and, we have to move to other rooms during our stay. The location is excellent, but all the rest is awful, poor lights, stains in the upholstery, the walls, the carpet, bad A/C dark bathrooms, few and dirty towels.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is actually situated on the corner of St Mark's Square!”
Reviews.Author: magpie385
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite at this hotel for 2 nights. If you take a water bus from the airport to the St Marco bus stop, you'll find this hotel just 5 minutes walk from the bus station. This hotel is not just situated near St Mark's square, it's virtually on St Mark's Square! Right next door to the Chanel and LV shops. The room was immaculately clean and the service second to none I have found anywhere so far. It is the perfect hotel to stay at in Venice although a tad on the pricey side, but if you can afford the extra, if you want both location and luxury, than this hotel ticks all the boxes. The decor speaks quality and everything about this hotel is well thought out, from the turn down service in the evenings to the placement of slippers by the side of your bed ready for you to return to at night. All the staff were friendly and welcoming and on the whole I did not find anything i can fault about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Baglioni”
Reviews.Author: Beinush
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week end. I booked Baglioni because I had good experience with Baglioni in London but was disappointed here. The room was nice and very well decorated. But the lobby of the hotel looks old and outdated. Service was not as expected. Quite expensive for the value...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay in Venice - Luna Hotel Baglioni”
Reviews.Author: JJON
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice style. free internet. Rooms are reasonable size, with nice bathrooms.The staff could not have been more helpful. A great location, with water taxi from airport right to the front door of the hotel. A few steps to St.Marks square, covenient to shops, restaurants. We spent every day walking around. It was great. Lots of cultural aspects and history of course. The gondala trip is a must and the Grand Canal trip also. 2-3 days is probably enough. It is an expensive city but it caters almost entirely to tourists, so that is hardly surprising. Outside of the hotel, we found a few small coffee shops to serve a small breakfast but don't expect much. Lots of restaurants, many of which tend to stop serving food about 3pm. For dinner, you may want to try to get off the beaten track if you want to find something more that the usual tourist menu; lots of backstreets with little restaurants. Italian wine is great. I would recommend this hotel but also saw a few more nice hotels next door/close as well, so you have a good choice. Harry's Bar is next door. Venice is definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly worthwhile hotel”
Reviews.Author: smb219
Reviews.Content: The Luna Hotel Baglioni is absolutely wonderful. The location couldn't be better, the staff couldn't be more accommodating, the food is exquisite, the room spacious and comfortable. Treat yourself to a five-star hotel while in Venice. The water taxi pulls up to the front door, and you're literally around the corner from St. Mark's Square, yet in a quiet, peaceful location. We decided we walked far enough in Venice and would have dinner in the hotel. The concierge graciously gave us a 10% off coupon, and the restaurant didn't nickel and dime us with charges for water, a cover charge, etc., that other Venetian restaurants do. Consequently we didn't spend any more there than at other restaurants, and we were in an elegant locale with top-shelf service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: rojohn7777
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decoration. Very comfortable beds. Everyone very friendly and helpful. Christain was one of our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & pleasant staff during our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: fdeva13
Reviews.Content: The Luna is easily one of the most elegant hotels in Venice. It's centrally located, so walking to the Piazza or strolling to Harry's Bar isliterally a few minutes by foot. Upon arrival, the friendly staff greeted us & promptly took our luggage while we checked in. The front desk was very helpful as they gave us a tour of the hotel & our suite. The suite was nothing short of spectacular. We enjoyed a beautiful sitting area in the suite, where the staff had already placed complimentary champagne on ice for us. The rest of the suite was just as nice, an ample bathroom and bedroom made our stay very pleasant. The bed was extremely comfortable, which was great after a long day of walking around Venice. In the morning, you should not pass up the complimentary breakfast. It is not your run of the mill toast, oj & cereal. The staff provides a hot breakfast complete with juices, pastries and such. Overall, my wife & I were extremely pleased with the hotel & the staff. Booking our stay at the Luna was facilitated by the people who manage the website WhatAHotel! which provided advantages over other sites. What's more, they were very helpful in seeing the process through from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “This is 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: DonManolo
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is perfect. From it's "private" dock forvtaxis and gondolas, to the check in and concierge's hospitality, attentiveness and being one step ahead of your needs, to the suites (we were upgraded to a trilevel suite with amazing views of the Grand Canal and St George Island, to their hand picked taxi captains and breakfast this is one amazing, beautiful, historic and well run place! And it's 50 steps from San Marcos plaza. Ask them to arrange a trip to la Vetrerie Riunite Calleoni (Bigaglia family collection) in Murano!

Reviews.Title: “A true jewel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: gmccabe1
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is located in the heart of Venice, one of the worldâ€™s true romantic settings. Adorned with antique furniture and spectacular trimmings it is more like a restored Venetian Palace than a Hotel. The dining room is spectacular and an absolute must. It is exactly what one would expect in a city like Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location , friendly staff and full of Venice charm.”
Reviews.Author: bigfunfamily
Reviews.Content: Fab location just off St Marks square, beautiful rooms and good freindly service

Reviews.Title: “Luxury decor, awful beds!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tanya13
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Luna baglioni for 3 nights in February for a valentines break. When we reached Venice the weather was awful and it was raining heavily. The water under the bridge just before the hotel had risen too high so our private water taxi could not get to the front of the hotel. Instead the taxi driver dropped us just before the bridge by the water bus stop and directed us to the hotel via foot. Ok fine not a problem except the foot path to the rear entrance was completely flooded so what now? Took us an almost 45 mins to get to the hotel via st marks square, which was also flooded.....we were dragging our suitcases on tables which had been erected in and around the flooded square. Soaking wet n battered by the wind we finally arrived at the hotel which was really cosy and decorated to a high standard. Check in was fine but I found our hotel room too small. Typically small European room with very little natural light coming in. The main complaint about this hotel was the awful beds. So so uncomfortable. Me and my husband had 3 terrible sleeps!!!!! We didn't ever eat at the hotel except the continental breakfast which was really nice. The location was great but I would only ever visit in the summer months and I definately would not risk staying at the Luna again as I want to enjoy my sleep!!! We always stay in 5 star properties but I do not understand how the Luna is classed as a Leading Hotel?! Gorgeous decor but not 100% 5 star...but maybe this is the European 5 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, most romantic”
Reviews.Author: MandMLondon_NewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Luna Baglioni in May 2009 for our wedding anniversary. This hotel was wonderful and just what we wanted from our romantic trip. First of all, we took the water taxi from the airport, which goes directly to the hotel. Our trip couldn't start in a more romantic way. We booked the suite for 4 nights and were happy with our choice. The hotel is located in a historical building, steps from San Marco square and next to the Harry's Bar - Cipriani restaurant. The staff was lovely and the breakfast decent in an impressive ballroom. We didn't spent much time inside and haven't tried any facilities but we were impressed with the staff knowledge and suggestions as one night we realized the restaurant we wanted to go to was closed. They recommended even better one! My husband is Italian and he prepared well, so if he was impressed, so will you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jhw1979
Reviews.Content: Perfect central location, very helpful staff, big and comfortable rooms. A bit noisy at night but it was Carnival, and usually everyone's tucked up in bed by eleven so wouldn't normally be a problem. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “perfect venice hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Fabiolaabu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night here before heading to the Gritti Palace for the second night. For 100 euros a night less we enjoyed this hotel much more. The staff was very helpful and the room was very very comfortable and roomy. We were even given an upgrade o a larger suite with a small porch that had a view of the canal. The hotel includes a complimentary boat ride to murano island to see the glass blowing and a tour of he products after. If done again we would have stayed here and not gone to the gritti palace.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Decor, Great Service, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: AndreaTherese
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Luna Baglioni twice and greatly enjoyed both of our experiences. We found the staff to be very polite and helpful, the food in their restaurant was some of the best we've eaten, the decor is beautiful throughout the hotel, the rooms are a good size, and the location is ideal. We didn't find it to be particularly noisy and they have a private dock so it's very easy to get to and from the hotel. It is quite expensive but you can see they work very hard to maintain a high level of service for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ledgelight
Reviews.Content: We secured our rate for three nights on-line to have a junior suite with lagune view (the waters of the 'Grand Canal' entrance is where this hotel is located) and jacuzzi, calling again before we arrived to reconfirm our room type. The room we were checked into was not lagune view, and requested that we be moved into the room type we reserved. We were moved to another room that had a slight view of the lagune but had no jacuzzi. We requested that we be moved into the room type that we reserved and told them that we did not appreciate having to be moved again. We were told that there were no other rooms for us to move to and it was left for us to decide which of the two rooms we'd care to stay in. We made some phone calls because we were quite taken aback by what seemed kinda bait and switchy at a leading 5 star property. It was soon after that point that we were apologized to and offered another room by the hotels assistant manager who came to our door personally and led us to the Canale Suite. After a bumpy start, we began to enjoy our stay in Venice. The hotel is lovely. It is conveniently located right off St Marks Square, around the corner from Harry's, and there is a private landing dock right outside the hotels entrance, perfect. The two junior suites we were shown and the suite we stayed in were all wonderful. This 800 year old property has beautiful interior spaces. We did use the hotel dining room and lounge and enjoyed each very much and would have returned but there were so many other great places to visit. Our room was spotless, we felt well taken care of by all service people, with the exception of the front desk, and were satisfied with our stay. When we return to Venice other options like the Gritti Palace, Daniele, Bauer Il Palazzo, etc are all beautiful places too, it'll be so hard to choose where to stay next ! It's not okay to advertise a room rate that includes amenities that are then not provided. Since our visit in 2006 Luna Baglioni has changed it's website and they no longer offer the exact room type we reserved. This review reflects our experience with the hotels front desk personnel at that time and feel that a point should be deducted for what we felt was entirely their fault, they left it to us as 'too bad' and did not offer to reduce our rate, or any other remedy, and we reported it immediately. The hotel did correct errors made by the front desk staff and we were glad because the price and amenities were why we chose this hotel over the many other choices in Venice. I have not deducted the point for this property because it is lovely and everything else about it was terrific. We are familiar with other Baglioni properties and they are also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: jeff d
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel. Located next to Mt Marks square and central to all shopping the Luna Baglioni is a true 5 star luxury hotel offering fantastic high quality rooms, a great breakfast and located a short walk to all that Venice offers. If you want quality then the Luna is for you. We spent 3 nights at the hotel in a Junior suite. Views over St Marks square and a balcony in our bedroom offering views over the Judaica Canal. Bathroom was huge and even had a TV to watch while you have a bath. Book with a Virtuoso travel agent like FBI Travel, and receive upgrades, breakfast and VIP treatment. We are in love with Venice and my wife and I want to go back again soon. The hotel has a Bar and restaurant but it was the big breakfast that started our day in the best possible way. This was a fantastic holiday and a hotel we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “amendment to earlier posting”
Reviews.Author: happychappy096
Reviews.Content: When i posted that it was wonderful for a honeymoon having just been there to get married in Venice in early October i forgot to score the hotel.In my view it is excellent and i have rated accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and elegant”
Reviews.Author: rosem120
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. It is located extremely close to St. Mark's Square and The Hard Rock Cafe. Our room was beautiful and the whole hotel had a very elegant feel to it. The breakfast provided by the hotel was a nice selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SF3182
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Venice for her birthday and after MUCH deliberation, I settled on the Luna Hotel Baglioni (other forerunners were the Ca'Sagredo, Gritti Palace and the Bauer il Palazzo). I definitely made the right choice; we could not fault anything about it: - LOCATION: perfect - could be approached by canal or by foot; mere steps away from Piazza San Marco yet no disturbance to speak of; - THE ROOM: we had a junior suite; exquisitely appointed - light green silk walls, Murano glass light fixtures, Fortuny lamps, highly polished dark wood furniture, decadent bed frame and canopy and a HUGE marble bathroom (with his and her sinks, a walk-in shower with a rainforest shower-head and a separate stand-alone bathtub, etc.); - SERVICE: the 'Elite Service' (pre-arrival request for information about personal preferences) is a very nice touch. Also, the staff were very courteous and helpful - e.g., suggesting/organising activities; their restaurant recommendations were spot-on! - PRICE: I felt that the hotel was far better value for money than (among others) the Gritti Palace, the various Bauers and other comparables (which we also happened to visit during our stay). We will definitely be staying here again next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nicely decortated”
Reviews.Author: famtraveller7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for one night. The hotel was centrally located close to St. Marks Square. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was a small for a junior suite - one of the smallest we had in Europe. It was a little cozy for three people.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Luna Baglioni”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Luna Baglioni. The location just steps away from the Piazza San Marco is excellent and unexpectedly quiet. The only disappointment was the apparent lack of doormen, as no one was around to help us get our luggage from the water-taxi into the hotel -- we were on our own. Other than that, however, service was excellent, and the concierge was cordial and helpful. We had a cozy but beautiful room with sumptuous silk draperies and bedcovers and a gorgeous marble bathroom. The room was very quiet despite being situated on the mezzanine overlooking the entryway and a gondola dock. Breakfast was served in a magnificent ballroom that belonged in a museum. The breakfast buffet was massive and opulent. Be sure to have a cocktail on the tiny veranda along the canal -- there are only three tables and the drink prices are high (about 18-20 euros apiece), but the experience is worth it. We were served three different sets of complimentary hors d'oeuvres with just one drink purchased, and the waiter service was outstanding. We only wish we could have stayed here longer, and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “a very good stay”
Reviews.Author: MARCIAFERREIRAGOMES
Reviews.Content: the location is great. the bar is charming,breakfast is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better hotels in Venice”
Reviews.Author: esports
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from an amazing holiday travelling Italy with my husband. I had chossen my hotels largely based on reviews on this website. I chose top 5star hotels. We stayed in The Luna Baglioni in Venice - I had originally booked The Cipriani but changed to the Luna after I had read some negetive comments about it. I was so annoyed when we dined there on our first night in Venice. All I want to say is if you can afford it stay at The Cipriani - it is fabulous - it is a very simple easy boat trip from San Marco square which takes apx 5 minutes in a lovely and comfortable boat. There are beautiful gardens, restaurants and views. There is a large swimming pool and the service is fantastic. You can dine outside in the beautiful sunshine and have stunning views. The Luna Baglioni - has no such area to sit outside - there is little natural light in many of the rooms. The breakfast room is in the old ballroom which is fabulous but no natural light or views of anything. Also everyone seems to be woken by delivery boats, bin disposal boats etc every morning if your room is on the same side as the main entrance. In my opinion there are nicer 5star hotels indeed nicer 4star hotels - Most hotels are ideally located as Venice is small and easy to walk about everywhere. The Danelli, The Bauer (the one on the Grand canal), a few others I spotted and checked out whilst I was there where really very nice. I do not recommend The Luna Baglioni - it is a lovely hotel but there are so many better and nicer hotels equally well located and priced.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is like Magic and this hotel is in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: krabby
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip. My room was a standard room, but it was excellent. Fine furnishings and a rich decor. The staff seemed always on the lookout to make things as good as they get. Truly a first class hotel. And, the best part... Long after the cruise ships are gone you are a mere 30 second walk away to the square. At night the square is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeHibb666
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Luna Baglioni - chosen based on the reviews on this site. It was our first trip to Venice so have nothing to compare with, although based on appearances, we were very happy with our choice. It's a great spot for San Marco and the higher end shops/boutiques. We had a Junior Suite with a lagoon view which was just great - plenty of room, views of the lagoon from one of the windows and a balcony. Staff here are very helpful and courtieous. Nice bar and restaurant with attentive waiters. We were celebrating our 40th birthdays and there were some nice little touches such as the bottle of Cava and chocolate dipped fruit. Will be going back to Venice at some point and will almost certainly be returning to the Luna Baglioni.

Reviews.Title: “Five star luxury !”
Reviews.Author: Vivienn
Reviews.Content: Luna Hotel Baglioni is the best choice one can make to visit Venice !!! It's excellent from any point of view : location, staff, cleanliness, service...everything is perfect! We had a great experience on our stay during the Venice Carneval and they definitely make you go back. Our room was a junior suite with lagoon view...and...huh...I definitely recommend it to anyone...it's a nice experience... Thanks for the staff for the nice time we spent at Luna Hotel Baglioni!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterTBennett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and loved it. Marcs Square is just across the path and it is right in the middle of everything. Harrys Bar is about 30m but to be honest it is very overpriced and there are much better places to go. The hotel is great we got a water taxi from the airport to the door. The staff were really helpful and couldn't do more for us. We only had the basic room but it was great for what we wanted. Rome was my favorite European city but now Venice is certainly up there. I know some of the reviews on here have said that the staff are a little off but from my trip that couldnâ€™t be further from the reality.

Reviews.Title: “Short break in Venice”
Reviews.Author: eliseGb
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay at the Baglioni. We had never been to Venice before and chose the hotel partly from recommendations on Tripadvisor and partly from location. Staff are excellent, very welcoming and helpful. Hotel is smart, we had a junior suite and it was wll furnished, very clean with a great bathroom. Location is perfect, about 2 mins walk from the San Marco ferry stop. If you come by water taxi from the airport it has its own landing stage. Either way it's a doddle to get to.(For those on a first trip the ferry service costs 13 euro one way from the airport whilst a taxi was being advertised at 90 euro). The hotel is right next to St Marks Sq with plenty of shops and bars within walking distance. Our only minor critism of the hotel would be the price of room service, mini bar etc which even by Venice standards is pretty steep. Other than that it's an excellent base to see the sights and we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent suites, some of which with stunning view”
Reviews.Author: Destichado
Reviews.Content: We actually never stayed there for the night, but since we were given the contacts of the general manager from its partner hotel in Milan, decided to take advantage of the invitation out of mere curiosity. The extensive welcome showaround gave us a pretty good idea of the hotel, which is positive, nice and spacious suites, decorated to meet my expectations of a five-star luxury. I will definately consider staying there during my next visit in Venice if my budget permits

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel, but its just missing something ....”
Reviews.Author: LondonRouge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful, extravagant, impressive ... but it is lacking something. Without wishing to sound cheesy I think what it might be lacking is some 'soul'. Service is very good but it doesn't have that edge that I was hoping for. The rooms on the surface look simply stunning but if you look in the corners (of my parents bathroom for example) you can find cracks and small oversights (e.g. tarnished taps, bath sealant that is ready to be replaced and a jacuzzi bath that didn't seem to work). The breakfast room is breathtaking but unfortunately the breakfast itself isn't, it was very nice but not worth the â‚¬40. I benefited from an early booking rate with the hotel directly and on this basis I don't want to be too hard on the place because it is stunnning by other comparisons but if I had paid full rate I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Good Stay but not Excellent”
Reviews.Author: EliteTraveler1A
Reviews.Content: The Luna Hotel Baglioni is located right next to San Marco Square, making it one of the best locations from which to visit Venice. Our overall stay was nice, but not excellent. The hotel has a very old world feel, with likewise decor. Given the lack of more modern hotels in Venice, this is a great option, however there was some room for improvement. The rooms, mostly the bathrooms, are starting to show signs of wear and are in need of an update. The furniture, however, is very elegant. Having booked through the American Express Fine Hotels Resorts program, the included amenities are decent, most notable a nice upgrade, but the other food amenities (in terms of quality) were not the best out of all our travels. Staff: The staff does do a nice job at providing good service and answering questions promptly and with great knowledge. They are genuinely helpful when approached. The concierge was excellent, always helpful and giving tips on good restaurants, shops, and directions. No matter how many questions we asked, he was always pleasant and knew the answers. If you do go to Murano, choose the glass factory you go to after doing research on your own. One note - unless approached, however, the staff never went out of their way to make you feel welcome and never addressed you when you entered/exited the hotel nor never wished you a pleasant day. In fact, after taking a water taxi to the hotel from the rail station, no bellman was there to help with our luggage and staff just seemed to watch us as we entered the hotel, with luggage in tow. Room: We stayed in the "Suite Giorgione" or Presidential Suite. The 2 floor suite was elegantly decorated with fine antique furniture and wonderful Murano glass chandeliers. The room was extremely spacious and comfortable, as one would expect. A nice outdoor terrace has 270+ degree view and overlooks the Venetian rooftops and San Marco Plaza. While there is a small view of the Grande Canal, this suite does not directly face the Grande Canal. The bathrooms are nicely appointed, however are beginning to show signs of wear and could use an updating. Water leaked when we took showers and the window shades did not roll up properly. The suite also smelled strongly of liquor as soon as we walked into it. Overall the suite is elegant and nicely furnished. Hotel Food: The breakfast room is spectacular, although the food did not match. While the buffet breakfast is very extensive and has many choices, the quality is just average and not up to par with what a true luxury property should have. We did not eat in the main restaurant for dinner, although we did have lunch in the bar area/cafe. The waiter/bartender is very slow and not attentive. Lunch in the cafe was subpar for both our meals. On a side note, if you are in search of an excellent restaurant for dinner, go to Da Fiore (www.dafiore.net), the best restaurant in Venice (well worth the price). It was truly one of the best meals and service we had in all of Italy (do not confuse it with another restaurant with a similar name). Overall, this property is a nice option in Venice and its location is one of the best. Having decided that Venice does not really have any true 5+ star hotels as other cities do, the Luna Hotel is probably one of the better hotels in Venice. With a few improvements and service changes, this hotel could be the best.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Location”
Reviews.Author: DCtrippers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and two close friends went to Venice to celebrate my 50th birthday and we hoped to find a special hotel that would enhance our experience of this incredible city. Our prayers were answered by the Luna Hotel Baglioni. There is no better location in the City, only one building removed -and so protected- from the noise and crowds of St. Mark's Square, it is surrounded by upscale shops in a very safe area. The hotel is accessible by both foot and the water, with arrivals by water taxi being highly recommended. The vaporetto was 25 euros per person from the airport, the same as our water taxi, except that the water taxi was non-stop and all our own, and it took a much more scenic route, so it was a far better deal. The time just before Carnival is an especially good time to come, as the crowds are thin, and Venice's best restaurants are yours for the taking. The hotel was perfect - and the desk was extremely accomodating. Hats off go to the manager, Maurizio D'Este, who not only provided us an unasked, complimentary room upgrade in honor of my birthday, along with a chilled bottle of Asti Spumante on my special day. The staff gave great advice, helped make all requested arrangements, and made arrival and departure worry free. Our only suggestion for improvement would be that they should really include breakfast with the rooms, as the price would seem to justify it. That being said, the morning of our departure, while we were waiting for our water taxi to take us away in the dark before 6 am, the night staff had laid out hot coffee and tea for us - which was a welcome send off gift. We are very experienced travelers, and this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. We give it our highest recommendation, and will look forward to returning when next we are in Venice! John and Curtis

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: PASeamus
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was very pretty, our stay wasn't pleasant. When we tried to communicate with the hotel before arrival, they weren't very helpful. We were spoken "down" to when we asked questions. They got a gondola for us, but the gondoleer didn't speak English. I think we would have done better getting one ourselves. Breakfast was included, but not that good. There were many options, just not very tasty. I always felt like we were a bother and never felt welcomed. Mind you, we don't ask THAT many questions to be a bother! As I said, the room was pretty, but too hot. We kept turning the heat down, but couldn't get it down far enough. I'm sure there are much better hotels in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rlp815
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baglioni while on our honeymoon in November. We felt this was an excellent hotel and a good value. Location: Couldn't ask for a better location. Very short walk to St. Marks square. Water bus station was a few hundred feet away. Room: Fantastic, especially for the price. The room (Junior suite) was spacious (had seperate dressing niche and sitting area) and clean. The bathroom was almost larger than our room in Paris. Service: Very friendly. However, the person who took us up to our room did a bad job of explaining how the door keys work and left with our door key. Not really a big deal, but we came back to our room later to find the key sitting in the keyhole, which could have led to a very bad day, but it ended up fine. Overall: I would absolutely stay here again. I was very pleased with the room and the hotel. One note, we tried the hotel restaurant and found it to be the worst food we had in Europe, just not tasty at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in venice”
Reviews.Author: gath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Baglioni on the 9th Sept for our wedding, the whole experience was amazing, from arriving by water taxi to the hotels Front door (the only way to arrive in venice) until we regretfuly had to leave (in tears i might add!) This has got to be the best hotel in venice, the decor is exquisite and our room a Junior Suite was huge and beautifully finished, the room service was really good and every evening the bed was turned down and our slippers put at the side of our bed, also we were left a weather report and a chocolate on our bed every time as well. The staff throughout the hotel were extremely helpful and very friendly, One thing that we cannot thank them enough for was that on our wedding day there was a taxi stike in venice, and we needed 2 taxis to take our party to the ceromony and reception, ours were not running, so the hotel saved the day by letting us use theirs for the duration of the day. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and will certainly return, its location cannot be beaten 30 seconds to St Marks, i will never get fed up of walking there last thing at night when all the crowds have gone, there is nowhere on this earth that can beat its atmosphere, and we were staying right on its doorstep Bliss! Just one note for those people that complain about the noise. Venice is a city and the noise of venice is what makes it venice. Go to the top of a mountain if you want silence!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but remember to take earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: JackieBLondon
Reviews.Content: After reading many trip advisor reviews of the Luna Baglioni, we decided to chose it for a four day trip to Venice. It is indeed a beautiful, almost faultless hotel with its own landing stage, an absolute must for a hotel in Venice to avoid trawling the narrow crowded streets with suitcases. We booked a junior suite as reports I'd read had suggested that double rooms were a bit on the small side. We were glad we did. We were also aware from fellow travellers that it could be noisy. Our suite, although sumptuous, was still on the petite side but full of antiques and very clean although it did face the building opposite over a narrow lane, so there was no particular view. Nothing adequately prepared us for the din coming from the street below on our first night though. We were exhausted from a very early flight and looking forward to a good rest but our room was on the side of the hotel over the Gucci shop, which lead directly to one of the boat landing stages. For most of our three nights the noise coming from people walking to and fro to the vaporetto was apallingly loud even though they were only talking. This was probably due in part to the narrow street and high buildings which filters the noise upwards. Sleepng with the window open therefore was not an option. After the first night, we went to a chemist and bought earplugs. These were brilliant and afforded us two really good nights' sleep after that. I would recommend this hotel mainly because it has an excellent location. On our second night we had a lovely meal in the hotel restaurant, which is well worth a try even though it is not cheap by any means. The staff are helpful too. On another note, first time visitors should be aware that Venice is both horrendously crowded and very expensive so be prepared. We tended to wander to more 'Italian' parts of the city and sit and eat with the locals as the food is still very good but about a third of the price and it's less frantic. On our last day we travelled to the Lido, which is worth a visit as the beach is long and sandy and pretty deserted at this time of year. Not a restful break but a stunning city nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - wonderful Venice!”
Reviews.Author: fionado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Baglioni from 15th -17th August. I booked the room directly on the hotel's website and got a good deal on a Junior Suite by paying in full a month before we arrived. The hotel e-mailed confirmation of the booking and assured me that we would be allocated the best room in the category as we were visitng for my husband's birthday. I had booked this as a surprise and I managed to get him all the way on the plane before he found out the destination! We arrived at the airport and took a private water taxi to the hotel which was 95 euros. Venice is very expensive!!!!! The Junior Suite was lovely - fantastic view of the lagoon (we were on the top floor) and the hotel had left a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped fruit as a birthday welcome. Very nice touch. The hotel had arranged a table for us at Harry's for my husband's birthday dinner. We had Bellinis and shared the entrecote and they gave us a free birthday cake and sang "Happy Birthday". I think the meal with a bottle of champange was about 350 euros! The next morning we went out on a Gondola ride (200 euros!!!!) and spent the afternoon doing the tourist attractions and found some nice bars around the Rialto bridge. We also had a pizza at one of the ourdoor restaurants that evening which was a reasonable price. We went up the bell tower at about 7pm (as it didn't shut until 9pm) and avoided the queues. If you sit down at one of the places that have an orchestra playing in St. Marks Square, they charge 9 euros for the music, but this was a lovely experience. Best to stay at one place for the evening if you choose to sit!!! When we checked out, the hotel stored our luggage safely and called us a water taxi when we needed to leave. I could not fault the hotel - the staff were friendly and helpful, the room was fantastic and clean and we would return to the Luna Baglioni. The location was perfect - steps from St. Marks Square and all of the "action"!

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: hoolio26
Reviews.Content: If you are after a truly romantic, truly special stay in Venice, I couldn't recommend the Luna Hotel Baglioni more highly. Having said that, I stayed a wonderful two nights by myself there, and couldn't have been happier. This is one of those truly class hotels where everyone makes a point of welcoming you back from a day's sightseeing, or greeting you in the morning, by name. The concierge here is terrific -- he got me tickets for things and answered all my questions with a sincerity and care that made me feel very special. The rooms! Glamorous Venetian style, all silks and flowing curtains and opulence. Perhaps, not for the minimalist. I had a huge bathroom with a claw bath and a tiny balcony that had water views and looked down onto the Cipriani. The location, just behind San Marco is great. All those church bells! Lovely. But it's on a little deadend street, so despite being on the square, it's still not too rowdy around the place. And the water taxi can pull up right at the front door! Though it is also right near the San Marco ferry station. This place is simply lovely. I did find the corridors a little Barton Fink, but in the oldest hotel in Venice, you can expect a little, um, atmosphere in some parts. Treat yourself, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: BrazilFamily4
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Spacious and super location in the middle of everything! Great staff, super clean and confortable!

Reviews.Title: “Budget 5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryOnABudgetNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Luna for two days in June with my family. The triple room we stayed in was very spacious for a family of three including a teenager. The room was clean, but the curtain had a smoking smell despite being a non-smoking room. Also, we found it inconvenient that there were closets but no chest for unpacking clothes. It had free wireless internet connectivity. The hotel is in a great location close to sites, but it is in a very crowded section of the town. We usually select a hotel in the center of the town, but in Venice, it is so easy to take water buses to everywhere, so we may stay in a less crowded place next time if we go back. The hotel staff were all professional but some were much more friendly than others, and the quality seemed to vary. As for dining, I had read reviews of others and had a dinner at hotel's Canova restaurant, but I feel it is overrated. The quality was decent, but when appetizers cost more than 30 euros, I expect higher quality. In contrast, the neighborhood restaurant Osteria San Marco that the concierge recommended was the best among seven or eight we tried in three cities - Siena, Florence, and Venice - during our trip. Breakfast at the hotel was Ok. The price at this hotel was a bargain compared with other 5-star hotels, and given its location and a decent room (at least in the case of our triple room), this hotel is worth a visit for someone who prefers a luxury hotel but has a limited budget. However, if we go back, I probably want to try some other 5-star hotel for comparison, and as mentioned before, we may look for a hotel in a less crowded place or even a different island.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and experience”
Reviews.Author: Everycontinent
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Luna Hotel Baglioni and also enjoyed three other properties in the Baglioni Hotels group in other cities. The lovely and inviting website describes Baglioni Tour, where one can stay over a two-week period in at least three of their properties, for two nights each minimum. It is a great deal, and we were treated like royalty in each property; the others we visited were in Florence, Bologna and Punta Ala. The Luna is a stellar property, with beautiful appointments, restaurant, spectacular breakfast room and impeccable service -- and the location cannot be beat. It is literally steps away from San Marco, from Harry's Bar, and the vaporetto or traghetto stops. We took a very short traghetto ride (inexpensive 'local' way to cross the Canal - a 'gondola ferry') over to the Peggy Guggenheim Collection - a must. We walked to the Teatro La Fenice for an amazing performance of Tosca. The very kind and efficient Concierge, Antonio Massari, managed to get incredible box seats for our group of four. We contacted him by e-mail several weeks before the trip. We procured a gondola right outside the lobby bar for a ride at dusk, and for our return to the train station for a sad departure from Venice, a water taxi picked us up in the same place - making baggage handling a breeze. Everything ran smoothly at the Luna Hotel Baglioni, and the property itself is stunning. It is also on a quiet street. Highly recommendable, and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Location”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: What a location!!! Stunning hotel right on S.Marco. Junior suite was very nice and comfortable.Service was what you expect from a boutique hotel...full of warmth and excellence. The dining experience was not that great with the breakfast menu very thin. Room service not any better. However you cant really go hungry in Venice Overall, loved the Luna Baglioni

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but ...”
Reviews.Author: HuarenToronto
Reviews.Content: This smallish hotel is stunning; if you're in a suite. otherwise, no views, no space and a little cramped. We stayed in a suite for 2 nights - had views of the Campanile and the alley on the other side. The bathroom is stunning in marble and high ceilings (over 3 m high). However, the staff are officious, cool and not interested in finding out what you really want to do. Instead, staff push the free boat rides to Murano (and shopping at certain places). The lobby is small as is the dining area - but the breakfast (which can be pricy at Euro 30 or more) is on the second floor previous 17th century ballroom. Overall, would not have enjoyed stay or not stayed at all if not for the suite.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cassieYorkshire
Reviews.Content: East Ridings of Yorkshire, England 8th March 2008 This was our first time in venice which was fantastic. We loved this hotel, good location,ambience and restaurants. Our junior suite was beautifully furnished with a lovely view over to san giorgi maggiore. The Luna Baglioni met all our expectations, conveinent for San Marc square and for the vaporetto to the airport which is the cheapest way to travel. All the staff were so helpful and made you feel very special. We will definately stay at this hotel again. Food was excellent but we did think breakfast overpriced at 33 euros each. You will not regret staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience at the Luna!”
Reviews.Author: MissSunshine15
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is 5*! I booked a junior suite for 4 nights(a suprise for my husband's birthday.) We arrived by private water taxi (WELL worth the 90 Euros) straight to the hotel's landing stage. We were greeted by very welcoming staff on the door and in the reception. Our luggage was taken up seperately and we were shown our suite. As we arrived in the evening, there were candles lit in the bedroom and bathroom! These were in fact lit every night. The suite, although not huge was lovely. We had a bottle of Prosecco, and strawberries and cherries dipped in chocolate waiting for us too! The bed was very comfortable and had linen sheets! The curtains were silk. The bathroom was very well equiped (bathrobes, slippers, weigh scales etc) and a powerful shower. We did not have a Lagoon view unless we leant out of the window (see photos) but it didn't matter. The breakfast room (we had breakfast included) was the height of elegance (see pictures). We even had Bucks Fizz each morning along with eggs, sausage, bacon, variety of fresh fruit, pastries etc, whatever you wanted. We had one dinner at the Canova restaurant included as we had booked a suite. It was wonderful. The service was perfect; attentive but not too much. The food could not have been better. The wine list is expensive, like everything else in the hotel and Venice, but as we didn't have to pay for the meal, we didn't mind too much! We were offered (and took) a complimentary water taxi to Murano to a glass factory which was lovley. Had an excellent trip out there. There was also entry to the casino free and money off at various designer boutiques supplied by the hotel. Overall it was a wonderful trip. Venice is beautiful and very romantic. The sun shone all day every day and the staff at the Luna will do anything to help. It was worth every Euro for a special occassion!

Reviews.Title: “The only bad bit was leaving”
Reviews.Author: harry0690
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four - parents and twin 17 year olds. We stayed at the Luna over New Years' for 5 nights. Our rooms, 307 and 309 overlooked the canal with tiny balconies. It needs saying that for a well-travelled family, this was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The rooms were elegant, the bathrooms what you would expect for the price, the breakfast room an event in itself - carving smoked salmon and drinking Prosecco at 8 in the morning is what a holiday is all about. The concierge, Antonio, was really helpful (try his recommendation for a casual drink or meal - Bacaro - just round the corner from the hotel - San Marco 1345). The location is dynamite - central to everything. If I could offer one piece of advice - go in the off-season, it's still a bit crowded and I seriously don't want to be there in summer. This is a truly terrific hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star plus”
Reviews.Author: dimpkins
Reviews.Content: Superb position 5star plus service excellent rooms bar and restaurant highly recommended would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Luna!”
Reviews.Author: greecemania
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Luna Hotel Baglioni for 3 nights at Christmas. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel which is conviniently located, a step away from the Piazza San Marco. The concierge was very helpful and all of their recommendations were very good! We had dinner at their Canova Restaurant which was just amazing! Excellent food and service. We really hope to go back next year...

Reviews.Title: “lovley christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: sharuss
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights at this hotel over the Christmas holiday. It should have been 9 but we were called back home due to a family illness. As it was not in line with the hotels cancellation policy of 48 hours we had to pay for our missed night but at a reduced rate. For the money we spent there I thought they could have been more helpful That was the bad but the good was very good. We had room 258 a junior suite; it looked over one of the busy streets so noise was noticeable however this was part of the atmosphere of being in a Venice hotel sited in the main drag. This did not spoil our stay but if you want quiet especially at night and in the early morning you may want to think about this. Our room was lovely , it was clean well decorated had a huge bathroom with a double shower and the turn down service evey night left candles in both the room and bathroom which was very romantic. On the whole the staff were polite and chatty especially at breakfast although I thought breakfast prices were a bit excessive. We had Christmas dinner in the hotel restaurant which was OK but not memorable there are much better restaurants in town. This was the third time we had spent Christmas in Italy at a 5 star hotel and the other two i.e. the Danelli Venice and the Eden hotel in Rome provide little gifts. This was not the case for the Luna although we did get a bottle of wine when we arrived. Overall we liked this hotel we had a great room and really enjoyed our holiday, if you want to eat a fantastic meal try La Caravella or Fiaschetteria Toscanna. They are not cheap but the food was out of this world (Toscanna fried fish delicious). The Ristorante al Gigilo was slightly cheaper but just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Balance of Location, Quality & Service”
Reviews.Author: AltamonteTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and we desired a 4 or 5 star hotel with a good location as a home base for daily walking tours, and a high quality comfortable room for a week's stay. The Luna Hotel Baglioni perfectly met all of our expectations. It is conveiently located next to San Marco, our Junior Suite was beautifuly furnished, the housekeeping is immaculate, and the concierge services are outstanding. I requested a flower arrangement upon arrival as a gift to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The hotel confimed the cost and delivery prior to our arrival, and the arrangement was stunning. The conceirge service is very helpful in making reservations and recommendations. The exterior views are primarily of courtyards and roof tops, but the rooms are so well done, the views are secondary here. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichmondTowers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this outstanding hotel having stayed there for 3 nights to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. The location, ambience, restaurants, bedrooms are all outstanding. You will not regret choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Take a water taxi”
Reviews.Author: spurg
Reviews.Content: The good: lovely, quiet location near st. marco square. We paid 500 euros a night for deluxe and were upgraded at check in to a large suite on the top floor. room 417. Nice sized living room. Nice sized bedroom with king bed. Large hallway with dressing area. Nice jacuzzi tub. twin sinks. There is no one above you so great for sleeping . Very peaceful and still in this room. The bad: No canal views from 417. but decor was nice - a bit dated perhaps. After you get off the elevator you have to take a set of stairs to get up to your room. So don't drink too much when you are out. The hotel location: Location is amazing-right next to the main square. Theoretically, you could take the public vaporetto water taxi from the airport or train station since the hotel is right offf the main square where the boat stops... ... but don't do it. pay for a private water taxi. it is the one splurge i would highly recommend. skip dinner and a gandola ride if you have to but get your won private water taxi. you will thank me later. Hotel costs: breakfast is 30 euros( if you opt out). Internet is free. fruit plate is welcome gift. Turn down service leaves free dark choclates. yum. We had a maid who left one of our windows open and we had mosquitos. The concierge got us dinner reservations at Da Ivo--we'd skip it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: yraveller1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here eight nights in October and found it excellent. The location is great: close to St Marks, vaporetto stops, shops and some excellent restaurants. Yet it is quiet, discreet and elegant. Our (superior) room was spacious with lots of wardrobe and drawer space, as was the bathroom. The view was better forgotten. The reception/concierge staff were excellent and had sound ideas on other restaurants â€“ and gave good instructions for walking to them. Service in the bar was sometimes slow - mainly because there were few customers. As well as drinks, it would produce salads and sandwiches. The self-service breakfasts cost â‚¬33, not â‚¬55 as previously suggested, and go on until 11am. There was an excellent selection of fruit, smoked salmon, cold meat, cheese, pastries as well as scrambled egg and bacon, but the juice did not taste freshly squeezed and the breads were disappointing (and the brown rolls ran out early). The ceiling of the breakfast room is definitely school of Tiepolo. The restaurant is elegant, with tables well spaced â€“ and sometimes fully booked. Most dishes we tasted on the two nights that we ate there were excellent, with only one disappointment. The service was discreet and friendly. Though the wine list does not say so, wine is available by the glass. This is not a place for those who fight shy of marble, gilding and brocade, and unfortunately there is no space where one can sit outside. If you want internet access, bring your own lap-top. But it is quiet, comfortable and well-located. We got the concierge to arrange our being met at, and delivered back to, the airport. At â‚¬190 a time, it was not cheap, but convenient, though we did have to search the arrivals hall for our greeter who seemed to have a long list of clients for whom she was searching. .

Reviews.Title: “We liked it better than the Hotel Cipriani!”
Reviews.Author: amwerewolfinlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and Hotel Cipriani the next. And we actually enjoyed the Luna more! Upon arrival they upgraded us to one of their top 3 rooms. (We had only booked a junior suite). The room was gorgeous and huge! It also had a 300 sq ft terrace! Breakfast was fantastic and the staff was kind enough to let us come in even after service had finished. (We were so comfortable in our room that we slept in!). It is a stone's throw from St Mark's Square and all the luxury shops. The staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: florent
Reviews.Content: The Luna Baglioni was the perfect hotel for us to discover Venice. 1 - It's just greatly located just meters from San Marco 2 - the hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful. We actually stayed at the Baglioni with our 11-month old daughter, which could have been such a weird experience! But luckily we were granted an upgrade from a junior suite to a suite with a real living room sepretated from the bedroom + room service is perfect (Thank you so much Francesco for your kindness) for everything you need, from parents dinner to baby bottle cleaning. We'll definitely stay again at this hotel and it's good to feel like nowadays some hotel chains know how to make their clients feel perfecto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sandytzaferos
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great way to see Venice. I booked 2 rooms for 4 people and both rooms were outstanding. The hotel is in close distance to St Mark's square, upscale retail stores, great restaurants. They have their own restaurant but we never tried it. We did have breakfast one morning at their room upstairs which was overpriced but good. Our view was not that great but who cares? We were too busy touring! I recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford it and appreciates luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BeauBeauDesMoines
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and very quaint. Room wasn't ready when we got there and when we finally got in there was a horrible smell. Finally had to be moved to a different room and we had a better view and no smell. Right next to St. Marks Square and all the shopping and restaurants. Reception staff was not the most helpful for a 5 star hotel. Not sure if I would stay here again. The location was perfect though.

Reviews.Title: “5* and more. Wow!”
Reviews.Author: 5*-I-don't-think-so
Reviews.Content: After having visited the Luna Baglioni in February, I felt I had cause to post a rather negative review of this hotel, but I am now prepared to change my opinion 100%. I now appreciate why this hotel is rated one of the Leading Hotels of the World. The opportunity came about for us to visit Venice again on 3 June and to stay at the Luna Baglioni for 2 nights. I am extremely pleased to say that this time around, everything was perfect. The service, the room, the food, the staff, everything! The best location! All the staff was very genuinely helpful and nothing was a problem. The accommodation was "Luxury with the Italian Touch" and very charming. The Canova restaurant needs high praise and mention all of it's own. I have for several years now, been employed by an agency to review many restaurants in London. I can honestly say that this restaurant would rate as the top restaurant in my opinion. The food was exquisite, the service was excellent, the ambiance relaxing and unrushed. I saw a different side to the hotel and would now be overjoyed to stay here again and would certainly highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a memorable stay in Venice. Venice in June is lovely and romantic, but our experience was greatly enhanced by our stay at the Luna. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Content: I did exhaustive research looking for the best hotel in Venice to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. I looked at the other big-name five star hotels (Gritti,Cipriani, etc.) and after I booked the Luna I wasn't sure whether indeed I had picked the best of the lot. I did. It is everything you want a five star hotel to be. It's clean and all the rooms are well-accented and tastefully decorated. The location is fantasic and is a big advantage over the other hotels I mentioned. A water taxi takes you to a private lagoon entrance to the hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful although my only small complaint is they could be slightly more attentive (no one held the door for my wife in her evening dress). Fantastic hotel and would recommend to anyone who wants to be pampered in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 star Lagoon facing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: We (my mum & I) spent only one night at this wonderful Hotel on 25 April 2007. I was quoted 515 euros plus tax for a Junior suite facing the lagoon, when I booked thru their website more than 3 weeks before arrival (tip - if you can book weeks earlier, see their website in detail for special pricing!). After slogging thru countless Hotel websites, trying to choose a grand but reasonably priced Hotel facing the San Marco Lagoon, I realised the Luna Baglioni offered the best value for money - though not the cheapest, but for the quality of the rooms and the location that they offer, its good value for money, trust me. The Hotel is located on the same block as the Harry's Bar, turn left upon arrving by water bus/taxi at the San Marco stop, cross a small bridge and turn right immediately when you see Calle Valleresco. It is really amazing how close the Hotel is located to the St Mark's square, merely steps I would say. Nearby are Chanel and other branded luxury shops. The only negative is, such shops close early at 7pm, but this also makes the Hotel extremely quiet at night, important for jet lagged visitors like us. Free wine/champagne and chocolate coated strawberries were nice touches upon arrival. However, breakfasts was not included in the price and since we couldn't eat that much early in the morning, decided to give it a miss. I had a chance to see its Marco Polo saloon's grandeur, where breakfasts were served each morning and its really quite fascinating I must say! As one would expect, the Junior Suite was spacious and sumptuously decorated, and the full view of the San Giorgio Maggiore island is to die for ....as I spent whatever possible time I had in the room, staring and admiring at the wonderful view. For the price we had paid, I thought it was worth every cent! However, make sure you get a good deal as the rate of the same room had gone up to more than 700 euros after we checked out the next day for the nearby Hotel Concordia. Have a nice stay at this Leading Hotel of the World!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, super location, excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Tshark
Reviews.Content: Short answer: Fantastic hotel, super location, excellent customer service. We stayed there in April 2007, two adults and a 10 year old child. For our Italy trip, with stops in various cities, I priced hotels through various means, including consolidators like Expedia and Travelocity, certain smaller booking websites, and correspondence with the hotels directly (either by e-mail or telephone). In this particular case I found the best deal at the Hotel Luna Baglioni by booking through the Leading Hotels of the World. After I had a reservation, I communicated with the hotel directly via e-mail to request help with transfers from the Marco polo airport to the hotel. They arranged a water taxi for me at a cost that was significantly cheaper than the best deal I could find myself on the internet. A side note on transfers. It is possible, and easy, to take an inexpensive vaporetto from the airport into the city. In my case, with a wife, young daughter and lots of luggage, it was better to use the far more expensive water taxi. The hotel arranged everything. Someone met us after we cleared customs, took us by car to the water taxi dock, then the water taxi transported us directly to the hotelâ€™s own dock. This was far, far easier than shepherding my family and luggage on and off the vaporetto then dragging the luggage through the streets and bridges of Venice to the hotel. And itâ€™s an extremely elegant way to enter the city. I had also e-mailed the hotel that this was a special trip for my 10 year old daughterâ€™s birthday, and requested that they assign us a nice room. The room was fantastic --- huge and beautiful, silk fabric wall coverings, a canopy bed, inlaid wood furniture, gilded and mirrored wardrobes, and a huge bathroom. As well as a welcoming tray of fruit and chocolates. The room and the hotel fit perfectly with La Serenissima of the Venetian republic! Throughout our stay the hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The restaurant is excellent and the room service superb. The breakfast room is quite ornate: huge with mirrors, chandeliers, frescos and murals. The hotel is in a super location, just a few steps from the Piazza San Marco, and less than 10 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY *****”
Reviews.Author: Aion
Reviews.Content: I have stopped in a junior suite. Chamber it's faultlessly pure and almost fresh (only small strips at a corner). It is a lot of sockets, no problems to charge phone and two accumulators at once. The truth one of two TVs did not work. In the rest it is felt, that it is luxury ***** hotel. A breathtaking view on a lagoon. A breakfast plentiful and excellent what should be in such hotel. Also as the personnel, especially the porter. It's a pity other clients of this hotel whom hasn't lucky with rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Venice a la Hotel Luna”
Reviews.Author: MalibuMom
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the finest yet under the radar hotels I have ever visited. Located a couple of minutes walk to St. Mark's, it is on the Canal. The rooms are beautiful. We had a junior suite that was absolutely beautiful, with a view of the Canal. However, the thing that sets this hotel apart from all others perhaps well known is the service. It is the epitome of discrete attention to the guest. Every day we were there (it was my friend's second visit) details of our likes and dislikes were unobtrusively, yet immediately noticed without the pretension one experiences at other hotels. This is a hotel with staff that truly care that one's visit to Venice be the best, and that the guest feels he or she is in one's home away from home. Absolultey will return only to this hotel, and to others in the chain in Europe if they are as fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great with Kids!”
Reviews.Author: staki50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Hotel Baglioni over half term Oct. Coming from London for the first time with a energetic 5 year old boy and 8 year old girl we found the hotel excellent. On arrival the kids loved the bowl of free strawberries in reception and the staff really let the kids enjoy themselves. When the kids are happy so are the adults. We were upgraded to a suite and the suite we had room 156 was very large by European standards. After unpacking (at 3pm in the afternoon) we headed straight out to St Marco Square. The kids loved feeding the hundreds of pigeons and we then went on a gondala ride (Euro100) quite expensive but well worth it as you get a guided tour and lets face it you only do it once. The driver even sung under the many bridges and I know it was an experience you HAVE to do. In the evening the hotel conciege suggested a low key tratteora , called Dela Pazza, . We were again surprised by how nice everyone was. The next day we went to the water bus to the jewish quater which was very interesting and the kids having leftover bird seeds fed the pigeons along the way. We walked to the Riata bridge and again went local for lunch. The children had ots of fun along the way buying glass animals and looking at all the masks. The last day we went to Morano. It was a great experience, one I would not suggest with very young children...but mine found the blowing of the glass facinating. In the afternoon the sun came out and we went back to the square for ice-cream and to listen to the wonderful orchestras. A few tips....Venice is walking ONLY. Take very comfi walking shoes. Great shops...all the brands...explore the side alleys off the San Marco square...lovely little shops. Stay close to the Square as all the action in the evening is in the square and it can be very tiring at the end of a long day trekking back to the hotel. Only downside... hotel very noisy at night but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “chraming old place, great restaurant, fab location”
Reviews.Author: AppreciateCharm
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed review on Luna, we took a chance on it mainly because our stay was short, and we wanted to be central yet reasonably quiet. Also didn't want to pay the sky-high prices of other 5-star hotels like Bauer...I don't regret the decision at all! First of all position is the best - especially if you have a room at the front or on the courtyard side), the back might be noisy from shopping street crowd in the daytime - it also leads to bus-stop so always people walking). We were upgraded first to deluxe room - and it was new and well-renovated in reds and golds - beautiful bright room. So don't think from reviews that all the rooms are old. We didn't actually take this room as there was some work going on in the courtyard and i prefer peace and quiet (the work is temporary). So we moved to superior room (orirginally booked - the staff did give us a choice) - it was a little smaller and not newly-done but it had an amasing position at the front with a balcony from which you can glimpse SanMarco basin, and from the window - a little park. and a clean small canal Also no foot traffic as the street ends there. You get taxis arriving - but not often (and you are not closed in like in courtyard room - you can watch what's going in vicinity. The room and bathroom were reasonable size - not too small at all, with two armchairs and a table, not just beds. Now about decor that people complain about. I say it's all a matter of perception: yes, it's faded and has some darkened marks in the corners near ceilings (may be it's damp air - but it's not dirt ) like you get on old buildings, but still you can see that the wallpaper is not cheap and still silky - just faded, that's all! Also while they are getting to redecorate, they do put other nice new touches - new bedspreads and chair fabric. Chandeliers are still beauitiful /traditional, and all the furniture highly polished. So i wasn't bothered at all - it just makes you realise you are in an old place, but still a cared for old place. it's the oldest hotel in Venice so i don't know why people complain if they knew it - it's possible to find a modern place if that's what you want. Still, even with the drawbacks the place is still more a 5-star hotel than 4-star. The hall is very beatiful and lots of crystal and paintings everywhere. As to the dim lighting - i agree - the fact is they just don't replace bulbs often enough (we had to ask to put new bulbs in our room - but they did it quickly) - in the corridors they should put more effort themselves. My complaint was the breakfast - although the choice of cold foods was fitting to a 5-star, the hot food and it's quality wasn't! Eggs and bacon always overcooked and instead of replenishing often, they just let it stew for ages - not good! Also the service is not adequate - no one ever collects your used plates while you are eating - and this is buffet so you do change several plates. There are just 2 waitresses for a big room. Teapots are tiny. On the other hand the dinner/lunch restaurant is great! Charming service and very good food! Not cheap but not too expensive for the standard. Great cooking! Though there is no view, the room is nice in an old-fashioned way with flowers and some music Not the brightest of rooms but i think it's dark-ish for atmosphere.. Bus-stop and park 2min walk, so is San marco.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: Dave_B_S
Reviews.Content: I had picked the Luna for our 2 day stay as part of our Honeymoon. I had booked the honeymoon package including breakfast, gondola, meal etc. I arranged via the hotel for water taxi to and from the airport and although expensive was well worth the royalty feel. At the airport we had a guy with our name waiting to take us in a road taxi 3 minutes to the water taxi. Then wisked into the water taxi, where we were taken via the canals to the Hotel's doorstep. The entrance is amazing and every other part of the Hotel follows suite. We entered our Junior suite to the sight of Champers and chocolate dipped strawberries. Room was amazing, view looked over the waterfront. Everything was just as it looked in the pictures on the internet. Breakfast was superb with everything from scrambled eggs, cold meats through to a smoked salmon to cut your own slivers from. Staff were all really attentive, with the slight exception of the guy on the desk at night, who seemed to love himself more than his job. His response time to any issues was in terms of half hours rather than minutes. I had read mixed reports about the desk staff, some brilliant, some poor. My guess would be that the poor reviews all relate to this guy on the night shift. On our second night we met up with 2 couples from the US and Columbia, while sat on the small but intimate bar balcony overlooking the canal. Our Columbian friend Rafael negotiated for the six of us to go on a night time Gondola ride with a second Gondola floating alongside with our own private musical entourage. AMAZING. After that we did not take up the free Gondola ride as part of our package, as how could we top that. The hotel is perfectly positioned just at the side of San Marco square, 30 seconds away, yet so quiet and has its own canal point. Nice touches with the hotel are the questionaire sent prior to going on holiday, asking what type of scented candles you prefer and things like what pillow would you prefer. The free hotel slippers are also a nice touch. Every night we are home wearing our slippers reminds us of the Luna. We would not normally stay in such a plush hotel, so to us it was amazing, but apart from the desk guy on nights, I could not find fault in the place. Cost is obviously a factor. But you dont get anything for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Disregard those pictures!”
Reviews.Author: canadian-eh-1
Reviews.Content: The initial room we were given was, as noted below by others, somewhat tired and faded. After complaining, we received another room that was very nice. But given the price for the first room, I did not consider it to be a 5 star hotel. The first room was barely a 3 star. Overall we were satisfied with the hotel except for several exceptions. On the Expedia website there are several pictures of an open terrace and silly us, we really expected to be able to have a morning coffee on such. With a great view of the canal. However, there is NO SUCH PUBLIC SPACE. The terrace is part of a single suite and closed to hotel guests. Look at the Expedia pictures and see what I mean. The single Internet computer off the lobby is the only connection available and was adequate. However, its printer was not setup properly making it impossible to print etickets/vouchers without begging the front desk for access to their machine. Others had trouble with the Italian keyboard. Indeed, I had to provide "tech support" to the type "A" who was unable to find the "/" on the keyboard and found zero help from staff despite several requests.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience. Will never stay here again! Not a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SisiWortham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luna Hotel Baglioni this June and had two deluxe double rooms. They looked nothing like the pictures of deluxe double rooms on their website. The rooms go in order from worst to best as follows: 1. Single Superior 2. Classic Double 3. Superior Double 4. Deluxe Double 5. Jr. Suite 6. Suite Obviously I thought that our deluxe double rooms would be a nice room, and as nice as they said they are on the website. They were not. The fabric on the walls was dirty and looked like there was soot all over them. The fabric headboards had marks where it looks like people rest their heads to read...very disgusting. The furnishings were not elegant. They looked new, cheap and very ugly. The bathrooms were fine, but nothing special. They did have double sinks, but I would expect that for the money we paid for these rooms. None of my other expectations were met by this hotel. I would have expected a classic double to be better than what we got with a deluxe double. I actually thought we had been given the wrong class of room when we checked in. I went down to the front desk to confirm that we were in a deluxe double and the girl at the desk was fairly rude about it. When I asked if we could move to other rooms in the deluxe double category and she told me we could not. She couldn't believe that we were not satisfied with our rooms. The AC did not work in one of our rooms. We had to go to bed with wet hair and a wet wash cloth on us! After 3 separate complaints about the AC we were finally moved to another room after our first night in the hot room. It was equally as ugly and gross as the original room. This new room only had 1 electrical outlet that was not being used, and it was in the bathroom! I ended up unplugging the lamp on the bedside table to charge my cell phone! They did have fresh fruit waiting in the rooms, which was nice. The concierge was also helpful in making our dinner reservations and arranging our transportation to the airport when we left. There was nothing else nice about our stay in this hotel. The deluxe double room on their website looks absolutely nothing like the rooms we got. I am very disappointed by this hotel and the amount of money we spent on absolutely terrible rooms. They say they are a 5 star hotel, but that is not the experience we had. We will not stay here again, and I will not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: TMCUSER1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Luna in Venice for part of our Honeymoon from June 4-7th. We loved that it is right on the canal and there are not too many things you will experience in life more romantic than pulling right in front of the hotel with your boat! We stayed in a recently renovated wing of the hotel which, according to the front desk, was just completed about 2 months earlier.
